analyzed: mdun du byas pas dge ba gang /
translated: What is virtue that is done in front?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'am /

analyzed: ri mor bris pa'am / mdun du byas pa'am /

analyzed: gang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po rnams @153b kyis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'o //

analyzed: gang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'am /

analyzed: phyug po dang rigs mthon por skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am /

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos dang mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: mtho ris dang / phyug po'i rigs su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa gnyis ni /

analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu ston to /

original: gnyen pos dge ba gang /
analyzed: gnyen pos dge ba gang /
translated: What is virtue by way of antidote?

original: gang rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spang ba'i gnyen po dang / gzhi'i gnyen po dang / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po dang / bral ba'i gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang /
analyzed: gang rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spang ba'i gnyen po dang / gzhi'i gnyen po dang / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po dang / bral ba'i gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang /
translated: It is the antidote of thorough repudiation, the antidote of abandonment, the antidote of basis, the antidote of distance, the antidote of suppression, the antidote of separation, the antidote of the afflictive obstructions,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //

analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa 'di rnams slar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: These antidotes of thorough repudiation and so forth will be explained later.

original: nye bar zhi bas dge ba gang /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas dge ba gang /
translated: What is virtue by way of pacification?

original: gang 'dod chags mtha' dag spong ba dang / zhe sdang mtha' dag spong ba dang / gti mug mtha' dag spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spong ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags mtha' dag spong ba dang / zhe sdang mtha' dag spong ba dang / gti mug mtha' dag spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spong ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the abandonment of all attachment, the abandonment of all hatred, the abandonment of all delusion, the abandonment of all defilements, the cessation of perception and feeling, the realm of Nirvana with remainder,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the realm of Nirvana without remainder, and non-abiding Nirvana.

original: rgyu mthun pas dge ba gang /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pas dge ba gang /
translated: What is virtue as natural outcome?

original: nye bar zhi ba thob pa de'i dbang gis yon tan khyad par can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //ğŸ”½ji ltar na mi dge ba /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba thob pa de'i dbang gis yon tan khyad par can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa rnams so // ji ltar na mi dge ba /
translated: It is the special qualities of the mundane and supramundane superknowledges, etc., which are obtained by the power of the attainment of peace, whether they are common or not common.ğŸ”½What is non-virtue?

original: mi dge ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are non-virtue?

original: ci'i phyir mi dge bar brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob ba dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi dge bar brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob ba dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa dang /
translated: Why is it considered nonvirtuous?ğŸ”½It should be regarded as nonvirtuous because of its intrinsic nature, because of its relationship, because of its consequences, because of its instigation, because of its ultimate point, because of its attainment through birth, because of its application, because of its being placed before one, because of its harmfulness,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / yongs su gcod pas kyang mi dge bar blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½phung po rnams dang / khams @154a * //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / yongs su gcod pas kyang mi dge bar blta bar bya'o // phung po rnams dang / khams @154a * //
translated: because of its possession, because of its being an adversary, and because of its being a determination.

original: bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is included in the aggregates, in ten elements, and in four sense bases.

original: bdag chos ma yin pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bdag chos ma yin pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro /
translated: It is the antidote to the false belief in a self that is not endowed with the Dharma.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is nonvirtuous by nature?

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes spyod kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes spyod kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is that which instigates evil conduct, with the exception of the passions associated with the mental organ, and with the exception of the passions pertaining to the realms of form and of the formless.

original: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang 'khrungs ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / rang 'khrungs pa las ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang 'khrungs ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / rang 'khrungs pa las ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The unwholesome is that which is not innate in the realm of desire, and that which is innate but does not manifest as misconduct.

original: de las gzhan pa ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni /
translated: The rest is

original: bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: known as the obscured indeterminate.

original: 'brel bas mi dga' gang /
analyzed: 'brel bas mi dga' gang /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //

original: rjes su 'brel bas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel bas mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being related?

original: de dag nyid kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi bag chags so //
translated: It is the propensities of those.

original: slong bas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: slong bas mi dge ba gang /

analyzed: des kun nas slong ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las so //
translated: It is the actions of body and speech which are motivated by them.

original: don dam pas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: don dam pas mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being ultimate?

original: 'khor ba thams cad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad do //
translated: It is all of cyclic existence.

original: skye bas thob pa'i mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being innate?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is, for example,

original: mi dge ba goms par byas pas de'i ngo bo'i rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba goms par byas pas de'i ngo bo'i rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: the unwholesome which is manifested by the ripening of the essential nature of the unwholesome that has been practiced.

original: des mi dge ba nyid la 'dod pas kun nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des mi dge ba nyid la 'dod pas kun nas gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the non-virtue that is the basis of desire.

original: sbyor bas mi dge ba gang /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor bas mi dge ba gang / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is non-virtue by performance?

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'o //
translated: It is, for example, the performance of evil conduct by the body, speech and mind, based on the non-cultivation of good people, the non-listening to the True Dharma, and the non-practice of mental attention in accordance with the Dharma.

original: mdun du byas pas mi dge ba gang /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /ğŸ”½lha'i ris gang yang rung ba la brten pa mdun du byas nas 'tshe ba sngon du btang ba'am /
analyzed: mdun du byas pas mi dge ba gang / 'di lta ste / lha'i ris gang yang rung ba la brten pa mdun du byas nas 'tshe ba sngon du btang ba'am /
translated: What is non-virtue by being in front?ğŸ”½It is, for example, the performance of worship based on the worship of a deity, preceded by violence or preceded by bad views.

original: lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas lha rten byed pa dang / gang du skye bo phal po che bsod nams ma yin par sbyor ba de mchod pa'i las la sbyor ba'o //ğŸ”½de la 'tshe ba sngon du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas lha rten byed pa dang / gang du skye bo phal po che bsod nams ma yin par sbyor ba de mchod pa'i las la sbyor ba'o // de la 'tshe ba sngon du zhes pa ni /
translated: It is also the performance of worship in a place where many people are engaged in unmeritorious activities.

original: gang lug dang / ma he la sogs pa gsod pa'o //
analyzed: gang lug dang / ma he la sogs pa gsod pa'o //
translated: Here, violence is the killing of sheep, buffaloes, etc.

original: lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas bsod nams 'dod pa dang / mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas bsod nams 'dod pa dang / mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the desire for merit and the desire for the highest goal, preceded by bad views.

original: gang du zas mi za ba la @154b sogs pas nyon mongs pas der lha rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang du zas mi za ba la @154b sogs pas nyon mongs pas der lha rten byed pa'o //
translated: It is the worship of a deity in a place where one does not eat, etc.

original: gnod par byed pas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: gnod par byed pas mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being a source of harm?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

analyzed: sems can rnams la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis log par byed pa'o //
translated: to do harm to sentient beings by body, speech and mind.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being a source of appropriation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'am /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'am /
translated: to practice bodily,

original: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa yang /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa yang /
translated: vocal and mental misconduct.ğŸ”½It is to appropriate the cause of an unpleasant

original: ngan 'gro 'am bde 'gror 'bras bu mi 'dod pas 'phen pa'am /ğŸ”½yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro 'am bde 'gror 'bras bu mi 'dod pas 'phen pa'am / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: experience in the hells, etc., or in the happy realms,ğŸ”½by projecting or completing it.

original: 'phen pa'am yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'phen pa'am yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The projection or completion

original: ngan 'gro'i dbang du byas nas 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i dbang du byas nas 'phen pa'o //
translated: of an unpleasant experience in the hells is projected.

original: bde 'gror yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: bde 'gror yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid de /
translated: The completion of a pleasant experience in the happy realms is completed.

original: gang gis der skyes nas dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis der skyes nas dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The suffering of poverty, etc.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that one experiences after being born there is called the fully ripened effect.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi dge ba gang /ğŸ”½gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi dge ba gang / gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa dag go //
translated: What is unwholesome by being adverse?ğŸ”½It is any quality that is adverse to the wholesome.

original: bar du gcod pas mi dge ba gang /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas mi dge ba gang /
translated: What is unwholesome by being an obstruction?

original: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dag go //
translated: It is any quality that obstructs the wholesome.

original: de ni yang tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: de ni yang tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba la sogs pa'o // ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du /
translated: This is also included in the group of the five.ğŸ”½What is neutral? How many are neutral?ğŸ”½With what aim is that which is neutral investigated?

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan par brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'bral ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du byas pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan par brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'bral ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du byas pa dang /
translated: That which is neutral should be understood from its own intrinsic nature, from its separation, from its connection, from its request, from its absolute, from its acquisition by birth, from its application, from its preeminence, from its conformity, and from its nonconformity.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / nye bar spyad pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang lung du ma bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / nye bar spyad pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang lung du ma bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as neutral by way of benefit, enjoyment, possession, antidote, pacification, and natural outflow.

original: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Eight elements, eight sense bases, and part of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that remain.

original: de la khams brgyad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la khams brgyad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the eight elements are

analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa phyi ma la mngon par brjod pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir sems la bag chags bsgos pa'o //
translated: The collection of names, etc. are the impregnations of the predispositions in the mind for the sake of the future arising of verbal expressions.

original: slong bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: slong bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral through being a motivating force?

original: de dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gang kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gang kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: It is the actions of body and speech that are motivated by the mind and mental factors that are associated with those very neutral states.

original: sdang ba yang ma yin dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi ming la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: sdang ba yang ma yin dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi ming la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: It is that which is motivated by the mind that is neither averse nor clear, and by the aspects of verbal expressions such as names, etc.

original: don dam pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: don dam pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral through being ultimate?

original: nam mkha' dang so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is space and non-analytical cessation.

original: skye bas thob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral through being innate?

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: It is the karmic maturation of unwholesome dharmas and wholesome dharmas with impurity.

original: sbyor bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: sbyor bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral through being a motivating force?

original: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
translated: It is neither defiled nor virtuous.

original: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i spyod lam mam bzo'i gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i spyod lam mam bzo'i gnas so //

original: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin /ğŸ”½dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i spyod lam mam /ğŸ”½bzo'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gal te nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /

translated: It is neither defiled nor virtuous.ğŸ”½It is the deportment or the creative arts of one who is in a neutral state of mind.

original: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur na /
translated: If one is in a neutral state of mind, neither defiled nor virtuous,

analyzed: de la spyod lam la sogs pa lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ro // gzhan du na dge ba 'am mi dge bar 'gyur te /
translated: then oneâ€™s deportment and so on are neutral.

original: ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would be either virtuous or nonvirtuous, as is appropriate.

original: mdun du byas pas lung du ma bstan pa @155b gang /
analyzed: mdun du byas pas lung du ma bstan pa @155b gang /
translated: What is neutral by being done in front?

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½lha'i rigs gang yang rung ba la brten pa mdun du byas nas 'tshe ba'am lta ba ngan pa rnam par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / lha'i rigs gang yang rung ba la brten pa mdun du byas nas 'tshe ba'am lta ba ngan pa rnam par spangs pa ste /
translated: It is as follows:ğŸ”½Having taken refuge in a deity, one avoids harming or having bad views.

original: lha rten byed pa dang / gang du skye bo phal po che bsod nams kyang mi skyed la /
analyzed: lha rten byed pa dang / gang du skye bo phal po che bsod nams kyang mi skyed la /
translated: It is the making of images of deities, and the making of stÅ«pas in places where many people gather, where people do not generate much merit,

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang mi skyed par lha rten 'dzugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa yang mi skyed par lha rten 'dzugs pa'o //
translated: It is the erection of a caitya without generating merit or demerit.

original: phan 'dogs pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is indeterminate as helpful?

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½bran dang / gla mi dang / las byed pa rnams sam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bran dang / gla mi dang / las byed pa rnams sam /
translated: It is as follows:ğŸ”½the abandonment of hostility towards servants, employees, workers,

original: bu dang chung ma rnams la sdang ba spang pa yin no //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma rnams la sdang ba spang pa yin no //
translated: sons and wives.

original: dad pa yang ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa byin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa yang ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa byin pa'o //
translated: It is giving gifts with a mind that is neither faithful nor respectful.

original: nye bar spyad pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: nye bar spyad pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is indeterminate as enjoyment?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin la nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pa'i sems kyis longs spyod rnams spyad pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin la nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pa'i sems kyis longs spyod rnams spyad pa'o //
translated: the enjoyment of possessions with a mind that is neither discriminating nor defiled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba las bye brag tu byed do //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba las bye brag tu byed do // nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œneither discriminatingâ€ distinguishes it from the wholesome;

original: mi dge ba la bye brag tu 'byed do //
analyzed: mi dge ba la bye brag tu 'byed do //
translated: â€œwith a mind that is not defiledâ€ distinguishes it from the unwholesome.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is indeterminate as grasping?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa na de'i ngo bo'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa na de'i ngo bo'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the cause of the body that is the basis of the skill in arts and crafts, because it is the cause of the body that is the basis of the skill in arts and crafts.

original: des myur ba myur bar bzo'i gnas de nyid la bslab pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des myur ba myur bar bzo'i gnas de nyid la bslab pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of it, one quickly reaches the culmination of the training in that skill.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is neutral by retention,

original: bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent impressions of the skill in arts and crafts cause the retention of that kind of body.

original: gnyen pos lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: gnyen pos lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral by counteracting?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: so sor ma brtags pas sman bsten pa'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas sman bsten pa'o //
translated: The use of medicine without examination.

original: nad kyi gnyen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad kyi gnyen po'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the remedy for illness.

original: nye bar zhe bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: nye bar zhe bas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral by proximity?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: It is the defilement of the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: zhi gnas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with calm abiding.

original: rgyu mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa gang /
translated: What is neutral by natural outcome?

original: sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: It is that which is produced together with the mind of emanation.

original: rgyu mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The causally concordant natural outcome is the â€œmind of emanation that is neutral and innate.â€

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis rtse ba'i phyir sprul pa sprul pa ste /ğŸ”½sems can la phan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis rtse ba'i phyir sprul pa sprul pa ste / sems can la phan pa'i phyir na /
translated: The mind and mental factors that are the cause of emanation are the mind of emanation.

original: dge bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It is virtuous because it benefits sentient beings.

original: yang bstan pas kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang bstan pas kyang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan par bya ste /
translated: It is also virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral by way of teaching.

original: @156a * // de yang gang /
analyzed: @156a * // de yang gang /
translated: What is that?

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
translated: It is that which the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas who have attained the perfections teach in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: de na de dag de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: de na de dag de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ni gang yang med do //
translated: But there is nothing that is really established in that way.

original: bstan pas kyang dge ba la sogs pa ni gang sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'dul ba'i don gyi dbang gi phyir kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pas kyang dge ba la sogs pa ni gang sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'dul ba'i don gyi dbang gi phyir kun du ston pa'o //
translated: The virtuous and so on by way of teaching are that which the Buddhas and so on teach in order to tame disciples and so on.

original: mi dge ba ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: mi dge ba ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How can nonvirtue be taught?

original: chom rkun la sogs par sprul nas /
analyzed: chom rkun la sogs par sprul nas /
translated: Having emanated as a thief, etc.,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir lag pa dang rkang pa gcod pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir lag pa dang rkang pa gcod pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he manifests the cutting off of hands, feet, etc., in order to frighten other sentient beings.

original: ji ltar na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa /
translated: How many are associated with the realm of desire?

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are not associated with the realm of desire?

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang ldan par brtag /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba zag bcas dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang ldan par brtag /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba zag bcas dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is that which is associated with the realm of desire investigated? That which is associated with the realm of desire should be understood as the contaminated wholesome and unwholesome and indeterminate of one who is not free from craving.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not free from craving means

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs tsam dang yang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs tsam dang yang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: not even possessing a mere portion of freedom from craving.

original: ting nge 'dzin mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as â€œseeing the meditative concentration.â€

original: gzhan du na ni mi lcogs pa med pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni mi lcogs pa med pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the preparatory meditative concentration would be associated with the realm of desire.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu spong ba la mngon bar dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i gnas ngan len spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu spong ba la mngon bar dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i gnas ngan len spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Immediately after attaining concentration, in order to abandon the negative tendencies that are adverse to delighting in abandonment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs su yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs su yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that they exist in the category of freedom from attachment.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni /
translated: External form, etc.

original: 'dir 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi dbang gis grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi dbang gis grub pa'i phyir /
translated: are not free from attachment here, because they are established by the power of karma.

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan no //
translated: Therefore, they are associated with desire.

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs na /
translated: If it is said that they arise by the power of the common karma of all sentient beings,

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams na yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams na yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then in the form and formless realms, the seeds of karma that are not free from attachment would also exist.

original: khams bzhi dang / dri dang / ro dang / sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / dri dang / ro dang / sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The four elements, the smell and taste constituents, and the nose and tongue consciousnesses.

original: skye mched gnyis dang / dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis dang / dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
translated: The two sense bases, the smell and taste sense bases.

original: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The rest of the aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na @156b spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na @156b spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: with the exception of those which are related to the realm of immateriality and to the pure ones.

original: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa /
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self not free from craving for the realm of desire.ğŸ”½What is related to form?

original: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are related to form?

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang rab tu ldan par brtag /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang rab tu ldan par brtag /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: With what aim is that related to form investigated?

original: gzugs la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dang / rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is related to form should be understood as the wholesome and the unobscured-non-defined form of those who are free from craving for the realm of desire, but not free from craving for the realm of form.

original: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa bshad ma thag pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa bshad ma thag pa rnams so //
translated: with the exception of the four elements and two spheres, as has just been said.

original: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang phyogs gcig go //
translated: The rest of the aggregates, elements and spheres, and part of the elements and of the spheres.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: with the exception of the pure ones of the realm of desire and of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa /
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from the craving of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½What is related to the formless?

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many [are related to the formless]?

original: ci'i phyir gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa la brtag / gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa la brtag / gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: With what aim is that which is related to the formless investigated?

original: gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is related to the formless should be understood as the wholesome and the non-defined which is free from the craving of the realm of desire, but not free from the craving of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: phung po bzhi dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Four aggregates, part of the elements, of sense-spheres.

original: khams gsum dang yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams gsum dang yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: Three elements, the mental faculty, the factor element, the mental-consciousness element.

original: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: Two sense-spheres.

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The mental sense-sphere and the factor sense-sphere.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: except for those in the realm of desire and the realm of form, and those that are pure.

original: bdag gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the idea that the self is free from desire for form.

original: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / 'jig tshogs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, freedom from desire is to be understood as freedom from desire for a part, freedom from desire for the whole, freedom from desire for the perishable constituents of the personality, freedom from desire through realization,

original: gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / legs par ston pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / legs par ston pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: freedom from desire through suppression, and freedom from desire through teaching.

original: de la phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ches bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ches bya ba ni /
translated: Freedom from desire for a part is

original: sa'i @157a * //ğŸ”½dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i @157a * // dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: based on the stages.

original: sa brgyad pa'i bar du nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i bar du nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Up to the eighth stage, it is in order to abandon the various kinds of passion.

original: mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase free from attachment to all is explained as follows.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: dgu ba'i spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgu ba'i spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression detachment from all refers to the ninth stage of the path of cultivation.

original: yang 'jig tshogs la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas slob pa ni phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang 'jig tshogs la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas slob pa ni phyogs gcig la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: The expression detachment from a part refers to the stage of the adept who is detached from a part of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: mi slob pa ni mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mtha' dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The expression detachment from all refers to the adept who is detached from all of the summit of cyclic existence.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through comprehension refers to detachment through the path of insight.

original: rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The expression detachment through subduing refers to detachment through the mundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through thorough knowledge refers to detachment through the supramundane path.

original: gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The expression detachment through abandoning refers to detachment through the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through realization refers to detachment through the path of insight.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The expression detachment through subduing refers to detachment through the mundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through thorough knowledge refers to detachment through the supramundane path.

original: legs par ston pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: legs par ston pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The expression detachment through abandoning refers to detachment through the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through realization refers to detachment through the path of insight.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through subduing refers to detachment through the mundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through thorough knowledge refers to detachment through the supramundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through abandoning refers to detachment through the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through realization refers to detachment through the path of insight.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through subduing refers to detachment through the mundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through thorough knowledge refers to detachment through the supramundane path.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through abandoning refers to detachment through the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through realization refers to detachment through the path of insight.ğŸ”½The expression detachment through subduing refers to detachment through the mundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The expression detachment through thorough knowledge refers to detachment through the supramundane path.

original: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid bcu ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid bcu ste /
translated: The expression detachment through abandoning

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / nye bar bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / nye bar bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang /
translated: detachment through natural absence of passion, detachment through harm, detachment through teaching, detachment through excellence, detachment through delusion,

original: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bal ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bal ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: detachment through antidotes, detachment through full understanding, detachment through abandonment, detachment through having a superior, and detachment through having no superior.

original: 'dir 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam pa bcu ni mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa'i don ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam pa bcu ni mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa'i don ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the ten kinds of detachment should be understood as the meaning of non-concordant grasping.

original: gdon mi za bar spong ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar spong ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not as the meaning of certain abandonment.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: The one who is naturally free from passion is the one who is naturally free from passion.

original: ji srid du spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni spangs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes pa lta bu'i tshig rnam par gzung bar bya ba'i rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni spangs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes pa lta bu'i tshig rnam par gzung bar bya ba'i rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The one who is free from passion through abandonment is the one who is free from passion through abandonment.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
translated: What is the nature of being free from passion?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the state of not being attracted to the painful feeling and to the things that cause painful feeling.

original: gnod pas 'dod chags dang @157b bral ba nyid gang /ğŸ”½'khrig pas zhugs pa gdung ba dang bral nas /
analyzed: gnod pas 'dod chags dang @157b bral ba nyid gang / 'khrig pas zhugs pa gdung ba dang bral nas /
translated: What is the nature of being free from passion through harm?

original: gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the state of not being attracted to sexual intercourse when one is free from the burning passion of desire.

original: nye bar bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
translated: What is the nature of being free from passion through satiety?

original: 'grangs par zos pa zas zhim po la yang gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'grangs par zos pa zas zhim po la yang gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the state of not being attracted to delicious food when one is satisfied after eating.

original: phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
analyzed: phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
translated: The highest detachment is that which is due to the excellence of the means.

original: thabs shin tu chen po thob pas thabs dmar ba la gang mi 'phrad par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thabs shin tu chen po thob pas thabs dmar ba la gang mi 'phrad par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the non-attainment of the inferior means.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten na thabs shin tu che bas grong khyer gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i gnas thob nas grong dpon la sogs pa'i gnas dman pa la mi 'phrod par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten na thabs shin tu che bas grong khyer gyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i gnas thob nas grong dpon la sogs pa'i gnas dman pa la mi 'phrod par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as in the world, having attained the status of a city chief, etc., due to the excellence of the means, one does not attain the inferior status of a village chief, etc.

original: rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /ğŸ”½byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //ğŸ”½de la zhi ba nyid du mi shes pa gang /
analyzed: rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang / byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do // de la zhi ba nyid du mi shes pa gang /
translated: The foolish detachment is that which is due to delusion.ğŸ”½It is the non-attainment of nirvana by the foolish.ğŸ”½The non-understanding of peace is that which is due to the absence of the means.

original: bdag 'jig tshogs la mngon par chags pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /ğŸ”½'jig rten pa'am ;
analyzed: bdag 'jig tshogs la mngon par chags pa'i phyir ro // gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang / 'jig rten pa'am ;
translated: It is the non-understanding of nirvana as peace, due to the attachment to the perishable collection.ğŸ”½The detachment due to the counteragent is that which is due to the path.

original: 'jigs rten las 'das pas lam gyi nyon mongs pa spang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs rten las 'das pas lam gyi nyon mongs pa spang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the defilements by the mundane or transcendent path.

original: yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /ğŸ”½mthong ba'i lam thob pa khams gsum pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang / mthong ba'i lam thob pa khams gsum pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: Freedom from attachment through complete knowledge isğŸ”½the attitude of disgust toward the three realms that is possessed by one who has attained the path of insight.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pas khams gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pas khams gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The attitude of disgust toward the three realms that is possessed by one who has attained the path of insight is

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid du yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid du yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the complete knowledge of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
analyzed: spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
translated: Freedom from attachment through abandonment is

original: sa dang sar nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i mi mthun par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang sar nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i mi mthun par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: the attitude of disgust toward the passions that are to be abandoned on each of the spiritual levels.

original: gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa nyid gang /
analyzed: gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa nyid gang /
translated: Freedom from attachment that is not the highest is

original: 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: the freedom from attachment of mundane beings, of disciples, and of hermit buddhas.

original: gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang /
translated: Freedom from attachment that is the highest isğŸ”½the freedom from attachment of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the dispassion of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: ji ltar na slob pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na slob pa /
translated: What is a person in training?

original: slob pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: slob pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many persons in training are there?ğŸ”½With what aim is a person in training investigated?

analyzed: ci'i phyir slob par brtag / thar pa la brtson pa'i dge ba ni slob par blta bar bya'o // tshogs bsags pa'i @158a * //
translated: A person in training should be understood as a virtuous person who is intent on liberation.

original: gnas skabs nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs nas bzung ste /
translated: From the stage of the person who has accumulated the equipmentğŸ”½up to the stage of the candidate for the fruit of the stream-winner,

original: thar bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thar bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par rig par bya'o //
translated: he is called a person who is intent on liberation.ğŸ”½From the stage of the candidate for the fruit of the stream-winner

original: tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni /
translated: up to the stage of the candidate for the fruit of the perfected being,

original: mngon par 'gro bar thar pa'i cha dang mthun bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'gro bar thar pa'i cha dang mthun bar rig par bya'o //
translated: he is called a person who is intent on the realization of the fruit.ğŸ”½The aggregates, ten elements, seven spheres, and also form,

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos rnams so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos rnams so //
