original: skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: The four aggregates, the element and the sphere of the mental organ,

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: the element and the sphere of factors, and also form, sound, and the mental object which is the name of the factors.

original: bdag thar pa brtson par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag thar pa brtson par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from attachment to the idea that they are striving for liberation.

original: ji ltar na mi slob pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi slob pa /
translated: What is the meaning of non-learner?

original: mi slob pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are non-learner?ğŸ”½With what aim is that which is not a learner investigated?

original: ci'i phyir mi slob bar brtag / bslab pa mthar phyin pa'i dge ba ni mi slob par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi slob bar brtag / bslab pa mthar phyin pa'i dge ba ni mi slob par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is favorable to the completion of the training should be understood as non-learner.

original: slob pa mthar phyin zhes pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnams mthar phyin zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: slob pa mthar phyin zhes pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnams mthar phyin zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The completion of the training refers to the completion of the training in higher morality, the training in higher thought and the training in higher wisdom.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: It consists of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres.

original: bdag grol bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na slob pa yang ma yin /ğŸ”½mi slob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag grol bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na slob pa yang ma yin / mi slob pa yang ma yin /
translated: because they are free from attachment to the idea that they are liberated.ğŸ”½What is the meaning of neither-learner-nor-non-learner?ğŸ”½How many are neither-learner-nor-non-learner?

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams ni du /
translated: With what aim is that which is neither-learner-nor-non-learner investigated?

original: ci'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brtag so so'i skye bo'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / thar pa la brtson pa ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brtag so so'i skye bo'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / thar pa la brtson pa ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Why is it considered neither a learner nor a non-learner? It is the virtue, non-virtue, and neutral states of ordinary beings, except for those who are striving for liberation.

original: de ni bslab pa la slob par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bslab pa la slob par brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is called training in the training.

original: slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'di la nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'di la nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The learner's defiled and neutral states are called learner. The defiled [states] here are non-virtuous.

original: ji ltar rigs par lung du ma bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan du rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par lung du ma bstan pa ni / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan du rig par bya'o // mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The neutral [states] are as appropriate.ğŸ”½The obscured neutral [states] should be known.ğŸ”½The non-learner's neutral and unobscured neutral [states] should be known.

original: 'dus ma byas ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob ba yang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob ba yang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned should be seen as neither a learner nor a non-learner.

original: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs so //
translated: the eight elements, the eight spheres, and the part of the aggregates, elements and spheres which are not associated with the mind.

original: bdag grol ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na mthong bas spang bar bya /
analyzed: bdag grol ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na mthong bas spang bar bya /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a liberated self.ğŸ”½What should be abandoned by means of vision?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many should be abandoned by means of vision?

original: ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar brtag /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar brtag /
translated: With what aim is that which should be abandoned by means of vision investigated?

original: @158b nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba yongs su brtag pa rnams dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: @158b nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba yongs su brtag pa rnams dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba lnga po dag go //
translated: The five views which are afflicted views, and the five views which are the forerunners of listening to the bad doctrine.

original: yongs su brtag pa bzung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa bzung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The taking of a restricted object is in order to exclude the innate afflicted view of the self and the extreme views.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the innate extreme view?

original: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i nga'i bdag gang yin zhes skrag pa gang las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i nga'i bdag gang yin zhes skrag pa gang las byung ba'o //
translated: What is the self of the person who is engaged in the realization of the truths?

original: the tshom dang / lta ba'i gnas dang / lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i sa bon ni /
analyzed: the tshom dang / lta ba'i gnas dang / lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang / de'i sa bon ni /
translated: The object of doubt, the object of false views, the factors that coexist with false views, and the seeds of these factors.

original: the tshom gyi gnas kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnas kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The object of doubt should be understood in the same way.

original: the tshom gyi gnas dang / lta ba log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang rnams dang / lta ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa dang / de la dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gang rnams so //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnas dang / lta ba log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang rnams dang / lta ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa dang / de la dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gang rnams so //
translated: The object of doubt, the defilements and secondary defilements that are associated with false views, and the attachment, etc., that are associated with them.

original: gang yang lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / ngan song ba'i phung po dang ; khams dang / skye mched thams cad ni mthong bas spong bar bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / ngan song ba'i phung po dang ; khams dang / skye mched thams cad ni mthong bas spong bar bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the aggregates, elements and spheres of the unfortunate planes of existence, and all the actions of body and speech instigated by false views should be understood as susceptible of being abandoned by the path of vision.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: except for that which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation and the pure.

original: bdag mthong ba phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mthong ba phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which sees perfectly.ğŸ”½What is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation?

original: ji ltar na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba /ğŸ”½bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du /ğŸ”½ci'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya bar brtag / mthong ba'i lam thob pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du / ci'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya bar brtag / mthong ba'i lam thob pa ste /
translated: How many should be abandoned by the path of cultivation?ğŸ”½With what aim is that which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation investigated?ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.

original: yan chad kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog par bag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba yongs su brtag pa las gzhan ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½'dir ni zag pa dang bcas pa bzung bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yan chad kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog par bag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so // nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba yongs su brtag pa las gzhan ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dir ni zag pa dang bcas pa bzung bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
translated: That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.

original: gnas ngan len rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.ğŸ”½That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm of what is not connected with the adept.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: That which should be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the realm of rebirth and the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of what is connected with the adept and the realm

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the factors to be abandoned by the path of insight and the pure factors.

original: bdag bsgom pa phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag bsgom pa phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with perfect meditation.

original: ji ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin /ğŸ”½spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du /
translated: What factors are not to be abandoned?ğŸ”½How many are not to be abandoned?

original: ci'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin par brtag / zag pa @159a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin par brtag / zag pa @159a * //
translated: With what aim are those that are not to be abandoned investigated?

original: med pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: med pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The pure factors should be understood as not to be abandoned.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni /
translated: One part of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'o //
translated: The part that is not to be abandoned is the supramundane part and the part obtained subsequently.ğŸ”½The part of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres which is not the factors conducive to insight.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs par phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //ğŸ”½de dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs par phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so // de dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The part of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres which is not the factors conducive to insight, plus the unconditioned factors.

original: ci 'dra ba'i gzugs dang / sgra'i khams spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i gzugs dang / sgra'i khams spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: What part of the form and sound elements is not to be abandoned?

original: mi slob pa'i dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the bodily and vocal actions of the virtuous person beyond training.

original: bdag rtogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na rkyen so so las kun tu skye /
analyzed: bdag rtogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na rkyen so so las kun tu skye /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is the knower.ğŸ”½What is the analysis of the conditions?

original: rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are the analysis of the conditions?ğŸ”½With what aim is the analysis of the conditions investigated?

original: ci'i phyir rkyen so so las kun du skye bar brtag / mtshan nyid dang / yan lag rnam par dbye ba dang / yan lag mdor bsdu ba dang / yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkyen so so las kun du skye bar brtag / mtshan nyid dang / yan lag rnam par dbye ba dang / yan lag mdor bsdu ba dang / yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: The analysis of the conditions should be understood as the analysis of the characteristics, the analysis of the members, the brief and detailed statements concerning the members, the establishment of the members as conditions, the establishment of the functions of the members,

original: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba dang / don dang rtogs dka' ba dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / so sor mi mthun pas kyang rkyen so so la kun du skye bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba dang / don dang rtogs dka' ba dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / so sor mi mthun pas kyang rkyen so so la kun du skye bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: the inclusion of the members in the defilement and purification, the difficulty of understanding the meaning and the members, the classification, the conformity and the non-conformity.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do ;
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do ;
translated: All, with the exception of part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: /'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: /'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the unconditioned characteristic.

original: bdag la chos rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chos rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as causeless and as arising from discordant causes.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as arising from a cause such as a divine creator.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu /
translated: How is it by way of the characteristics?

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang ; mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang ; mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from conditions that are not moving, from conditions that are impermanent, and from conditions that are capable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gsungs pa ni 'di lod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gsungs pa ni 'di lod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: The characteristics of dependent origination that were taught by the Lord are as follows: â€œWhen this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: due to the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, with ignorance as condition, there are the formative forces, and so on.

original: de la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ba ni /
translated: Here, â€œwhen this exists, that comes to beâ€

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it arises from conditions that are not moving.

original: rkyen yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba kho nar zad kyi /ğŸ”½'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba kho nar zad kyi / 'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If conditions exist, then only the effect arises.

original: rkyen g-yo ba ni ci yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen g-yo ba ni ci yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no movement of conditions whatsoever in order to produce the effect.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di @159b skye zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di @159b skye zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, â€œBecause this arises, that arises.â€

original: ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that the effect arises from a condition that is impermanent, because it is not established that an effect arises from a cause that does not exist.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement, â€œConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic formations,â€ and so on, means that the effect arises from a condition that has the capacity to produce it.

original: 'bras bu g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'bras bu g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although the effect is not permanent and does not move,ğŸ”½not every condition produces every effect.

original: rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung gi /'on kyang nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba ste /ğŸ”½'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung gi /'on kyang nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba ste / 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas /
translated: However, the effect arises from a condition that has the capacity to produce it.

original: skye ba nas rga shi 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skye ba nas rga shi 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus, conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic formations, and so on, up to conditioned by birth, there is old age and death.

original: yan lag rnam par dbye bas ji lta bu'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par dbye bas ji lta bu'o //
translated: How is it by the analysis of its members?

original: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams te /ğŸ”½rkyen so so las kun du skye ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams te / rkyen so so las kun du skye ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni /
translated: It is the twelve members.

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / srid pa dang / nyer len dang / sred pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / srid pa dang / nyer len dang / sred pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: The twelve members are the members that arise from the conditions of ignorance, action, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, thirst, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death.

original: rga shi'o // yan lag mdor bsdus pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rga shi'o // yan lag mdor bsdus pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it by the summary of its members?

original: 'phen pa'i yan lag gang /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i yan lag gang /
translated: What is the projecting member?

original: 'phongs pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go //ğŸ”½ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rim par phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: 'phongs pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go // ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rim par phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The projecting member, the actualizing member, and the actualized member.

original: yan lag bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The twelve members beginning with ignorance, which have been analyzed in order, are summarized in four members:

original: 'phen pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: the projecting member, the actualizing member, and the actualized member.

original: 'byung ba ni 'di dag tsam du bstan pas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'di dag tsam du bstan pas bstan par bya ste /
translated: The actualized member is taught as the mere occurrence of the members.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus na gang gis 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'grub pa dang / gang mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus na gang gis 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'grub pa dang / gang mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: Thus, at the time of the cause, there is that which impels and that which is impelled, and at the time of the effect, there is that which is actualized and that which actualizes.

original: de dag thams cad ni yan lag 'di rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni yan lag 'di rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the projecting factor and that which is projected, and the actualizing factor and that which is actualized, should be understood as taught by these members.

original: de la 'phen pa'i yan lag ni /
analyzed: de la 'phen pa'i yan lag ni /
translated: The projecting factor is

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: ignorance, the formative forces, and consciousness.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba bden pa rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyis bag chags sems la bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba bden pa rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyis bag chags sems la bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latent impressions of karma are deposited on the mind, preceded by the non-understanding of the truths, in order to project a future rebirth.ğŸ”½The actualizing factor is

original: 'phongs pa'i yan lag ni ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste /ğŸ”½de sems kyi bag chags kyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma la phyi ma brten nas rim gyis mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i sa @160a * //
analyzed: 'phongs pa'i yan lag ni ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste / de sems kyi bag chags kyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma la phyi ma brten nas rim gyis mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i sa @160a * //
translated: name / form, the six sense fields, contact, and feeling.

original: bon brtas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bon brtas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed of the actualization of name / form, etc. is strengthened by the latent impressions of the mind.

original: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag ni sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / srid pa ste /ğŸ”½'dod pa la sogs pa'i sred pa ma spangs pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la sogs pa la legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod ba'i rnam pa la sogs par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yong par 'gyur na 'chi ba'i dus na 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag ni sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / srid pa ste / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sred pa ma spangs pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la sogs pa la legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod ba'i rnam pa la sogs par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yong par 'gyur na 'chi ba'i dus na 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang /
translated: The limbs that bring about actualization are craving, grasping, and existence.ğŸ”½Because craving for sense objects and so on is not abandoned, consciousness with the appropriation of craving and attachment for the aspects of virtuous and nonvirtuous action and so on arises, preceded by delight.

original: 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i yang gang yang rung ba'i bag chags 'thob par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i yang gang yang rung ba'i bag chags 'thob par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of death, it is because it obtains any latent state that is compatible with attachment in order to issue a result.

original: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba dang rga shi ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba dang rga shi ste /
translated: The limbs that are actualized are birth and aging and death.

original: rnam pa des las gzhan pa'i bag chags 'ga' mngon du gyur pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa des las gzhan pa'i bag chags 'ga' mngon du gyur pa na /
translated: Because of that aspect, when any latent states of other actions manifest,

original: ji ltar 'phangs pa 'byin du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa gang yang rung bar ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phangs pa 'byin du 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa gang yang rung bar ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the projecting cause of the rebirth-linking consciousness, and because it is the cause of the establishment of name-and-form, etc., in any rebirth, such as an egg-born rebirth.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi skabs kyis skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi skabs kyis skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of birth and old-age-death is for the purpose of arousing disgust with the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba yan lag gcig tu bya ba ni /
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba yan lag gcig tu bya ba ni /
translated: Old-age-and-death is made into one member

original: dga' ba med par yang 'chi ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba med par yang 'chi ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to die without having experienced pleasure.

original: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par skye mched drug la sogs pa 'byung ba ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par skye mched drug la sogs pa 'byung ba ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: In the case of an egg-born rebirth, the six sense-spheres, etc., do not occur without name-and-form, etc.

original: de'i phyir de dag yan lag so sor dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag yan lag so sor dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be known as separate members.

original: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu /
translated: How are the members established as conditions?

original: bag chags dang / shugs dang / yid la byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas kyang yan lag rnams rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang / shugs dang / yid la byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas kyang yan lag rnams rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the members are also established as conditions through the power of latent impressions, the power of momentum, mental activity, and co-existence.

original: de yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: And this should be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The members are established as conditions

original: rkyen bzhi'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rkyen bzhi'i dbang du byas te /
translated: in terms of the four conditions.

original: de la ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen te /
translated: Among them, ignorance is the condition of the formative forces,

original: snga logs su 'byung ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu'i rkyen to //ğŸ”½de yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyang srid pa mngon par 'du byed nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snga logs su 'byung ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu'i rkyen to // de yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyang srid pa mngon par 'du byed nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the causal condition of the formative forces that arise previously, through the power of latent impressions.ğŸ”½The members that arise from the cause of the impregnation of that ignorance are also capable of actualizing samsara,

original: de'i tshe kun du 'byung ba'i tshul can no //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun du 'byung ba'i tshul can no //
translated: because they are the condition of the arising of that samsara at the time of the occurrence of the impregnation.

original: thugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: thugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The mind is the condition as the antecedent,

original: de'i tshe 'phen pa'i bye brag gis 'du byed kyi rgyun chags par @160b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phen pa'i bye brag gis 'du byed kyi rgyun chags par @160b 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because the continuum of the formative forces arises in a connected manner at that time, through the power of the particular projection of the formative forces.ğŸ”½Mental activity is the objective condition,

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
translated: because the mind is the objective condition of the formative forces.

original: rmongs pa'i dus na mchog la sogs par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i dus na mchog la sogs par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro // lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the object of incorrect mental activity in regard to the highest, etc., when there is delusion.

original: bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: The simultaneous cause is the dominant condition.

original: de'i dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung pa rnam pa dmigs pa phyin ci log tu mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung pa rnam pa dmigs pa phyin ci log tu mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mental activities that are associated with it form in a distorted way, due to the power of that cause.

original: yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it established as the action of the members?

original: ma rig pa ci'i las can srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yang yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ci'i las can srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yang yin no //
translated: Ignorance has the action of causing sentient beings to be deluded in regard to existence and it is also the condition of the karmic forces.

original: ma rig pa ni srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces pa ni des bsgribs pa rnams sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar ma'i mtha' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces pa ni des bsgribs pa rnams sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar ma'i mtha' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance causes sentient beings to be deluded in regard to existence, because those who are obscured by it do not understand the beginning, end, and middle of samsara as it really is.

original: 'di ltar ci 'das pa'i dus na 'byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci 'das pa'i dus na 'byung ba zhig gam /
translated: In this way, did it arise in the past?

original: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam pa la sogs par the tshom za'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam pa la sogs par the tshom za'o //
translated: In this way, one doubts whether the past existed or not, and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Condition for the formations.

original: de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by its power, the action of a new existence is accumulated.

original: 'du byed rnams ci'i las can /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ci'i las can /
translated: What is the action of the formations?

original: 'gro ba rnams su sems can rnams rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen yang yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su sems can rnams rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen yang yin no //
translated: They distribute sentient beings among the different destinies and are the condition for the habitual tendencies of consciousness.

original: 'gro ba rnams su sems can rnams //ğŸ”½rnam par 'byed ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su sems can rnams // rnam par 'byed ces pa ni /
translated: They distribute sentient beings among the different destinies.

original: las kyi dbang gis sems can rnams 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis sems can rnams 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They distribute sentient beings among the different destinies because, by the power of action, sentient beings go to various other destinies.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes pa ni /
translated: They are the condition for the habitual tendencies of consciousness.

original: phyi ma'i rkyen dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i rkyen dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the condition for the habitual tendencies of consciousness because they nourish the seeds of the future conditions, such as name-and-form.

original: rnam par shes pa ci'i las can sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ci'i las can sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: What is the action of consciousness? It is the support for the bondage of the karma of sentient beings and it is the condition for name-and-form.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The support for the bondage of the karma of sentient beings means

original: rnam par shes pa la 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that consciousness is generated by the formative forces and arises together with the latent tendencies.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the condition for name-and-form means

original: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs na ming dang gzugs 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs na ming dang gzugs 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that when consciousness enters the motherâ€™s womb, name-and-form increases.

original: ming dang gzugs ci'i las can /ğŸ”½sems @161a * //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ci'i las can / sems @161a * //
translated: What is the action of name-and-form?ğŸ”½It is the support for the descent of consciousness into the womb and it is the condition for the six sense-fields.

original: can rnams lus len du 'jug pa dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: can rnams lus len du 'jug pa dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: The support for the descent of consciousness into the womb meansğŸ”½that consciousness enters the motherâ€™s womb because of the descent of name-and-form.ğŸ”½What is the action of the six sense-fields?ğŸ”½It is the support for the descent of consciousness into the womb and it is the condition for contact.ğŸ”½The support for the descent of consciousness into the womb means

original: ming dang gzugs ni sems can rnams su lus len du 'jug ces pa ni /ğŸ”½de grub pas sems can rnams ris mthun pa gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni sems can rnams su lus len du 'jug ces pa ni /ğŸ”½de grub pas sems can rnams ris mthun pa gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that consciousness enters the motherâ€™s womb because of the descent of name-and-form.ğŸ”½What is the action of contact?ğŸ”½It is the support for the descent of consciousness into the womb and it is the condition for feeling.ğŸ”½The support for the descent of consciousness into the womb meansğŸ”½that consciousness enters the motherâ€™s womb because of the descent of name-and-form.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skye mched drug la sogs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skye mched drug la sogs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: This means that name-and-form, etc., are conditions for the six sense bases, etc.

original: yan lag snga ma la brten nas yan lag phyi ma 'grub bar blta'o //
analyzed: yan lag snga ma la brten nas yan lag phyi ma 'grub bar blta'o //
translated: It should be understood that the later members are established in dependence on the earlier members.

original: skye mched drug ci'i las can /
analyzed: skye mched drug ci'i las can /
translated: What is the action of the six sense bases?

original: sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes sentient beings to take up a complete body and is also a condition for contact.

original: skye mched drug ni sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The six sense bases cause sentient beings to take up a complete body.

original: de grub na dbang po gzhan ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub na dbang po gzhan ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When they are established, the other faculties are not incomplete.

original: reg pa'i las can /
analyzed: reg pa'i las can /
translated: The action of contact is

original: lus kyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / tshor ba'i rkyen kyang yin no /
analyzed: lus kyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / tshor ba'i rkyen kyang yin no /
translated: to cause sentient beings to experience objects through the body and is also a condition for feeling.

original: de'i sgo nas bde ba myong ba la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa gsum la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bde ba myong ba la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa gsum la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, through it, sentient beings experience the three kinds of objects that are the causes of pleasure, etc.

original: tshor ba ci'i las can /
analyzed: tshor ba ci'i las can /
translated: What is the action of feeling?

original: skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the enjoyment of rebirth and is the condition of craving.

original: de la brten nas 'dod pa la sogs pas las kyi rnams par smin pa la nye par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod pa la sogs pas las kyi rnams par smin pa la nye par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in dependence on that, one experiences the maturation of karma through desire, etc.

original: de dang phrad pa la sogs par 'dod pa'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang phrad pa la sogs par 'dod pa'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because craving arises through the door of desire for contact, etc.

original: sred pa ci'i las can /
analyzed: sred pa ci'i las can /
translated: What is the action of craving?

original: sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa dang / nyer len gyi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa dang / nyer len gyi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the leading of beings to birth and is the condition of grasping.

original: de'i dbang gis tshe gzhan gyi rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis tshe gzhan gyi rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by its power, the stream of life is uninterrupted.

original: ro myong bar byed pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myong bar byed pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because desire and attachment arise through the door of experiencing.

original: nyer len ci'i las can /
analyzed: nyer len ci'i las can /
translated: What is the action of grasping?ğŸ”½It is the cause of the appropriation of consciousness by beings and is the condition of becoming.

original: yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: Because, by it, one appropriates a new existence.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bye brag can du yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bag chags nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bye brag can du yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bag chags nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it definitely produces the latent impressions of action which will be the cause of rebirth in a particular destiny, such as the animal realm, etc.

original: de'i dbang gis 'du byed kyi bag chags 'byung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'du byed kyi bag chags 'byung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, by its power, the latent impressions of the formative forces find an opportunity to arise.

original: srid pa ci'i las can /
analyzed: srid pa ci'i las can /
translated: What is existence?

original: yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs @161b par byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs @161b par byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the continuation of birth and the condition for old-age and death.

original: de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to another destiny immediately after this one.

original: de las ris mthun pa gzhan du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ris mthun pa gzhan du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to another existence in a similar class.

original: skye ba ci'i las can /
analyzed: skye ba ci'i las can /
translated: What is birth?

original: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba rim gyis sems can rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba rim gyis sems can rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the manifestation of sentient beings in the world and the condition for old-age and death.

original: phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to another state in the future.

original: skye ba yod na de'i rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba yod na de'i rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, if there is birth, there is the possibility of the transformation of the stream and of destruction.

original: rga shi ci'i las can /ğŸ”½yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rga shi ci'i las can / yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o //
translated: What is the function of old age and death?ğŸ”½It causes the aging and death of living beings again and again.

original: dar la bab pa dang / tshe rnam par 'jig pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dar la bab pa dang / tshe rnam par 'jig pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the aging and death of the living being who is in the prime of life.

original: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdus pas ji lta bu /ğŸ”½ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa dang / nye bar len pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //ğŸ”½'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdus pas ji lta bu / ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa dang / nye bar len pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o // 'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
translated: How are they included in the totality of the defilements?ğŸ”½Ignorance, craving and grasping are included in the totality of the defilements which are emotional afflictions.ğŸ”½Formative forces and consciousness are included in the totality of the defilements which are actions.

original: rnam par shes pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba ni /
translated: Consciousness is included in the totality of the defilements which are actions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag 'du byed kyi bag chags kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //

The meaning of â€˜without a creatorâ€™ is the meaning of â€˜originates from the individual conditionsâ€™.

translated: The meaning of â€œdependentâ€ is

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa'i don zhes bya ba ni thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa'i don zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the diversity of cause and effect is thatğŸ”½from the aspect of many causes and one effect, many effects arise.ğŸ”½The meaning of the determination of cause and effect is that

analyzed: rgyu du ma dang gcig gi rnam pa las 'bras bu du ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni rkyen so so las kun du skye ba'i don zhes bya ba ni /

original: rtogs dkas ji lta bu /

analyzed: rgyus rtogs dka' dang / mtshan nyid kyis rtogs dka' dang / skye bas rtogs dka' dang / gnas pas rtogs dka' dang / 'byung bas kyang rtogs dka' bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: the difficulty of understanding the cause, the difficulty of understanding the characteristic, the difficulty of understanding arising, the difficulty of understanding duration, and the difficulty of understanding manifestation.

original: yang byed pa po med pa la sogs pa'i don 'di dag gis rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rnam pa lngas rtogs dka' bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang byed pa po med pa la sogs pa'i don 'di dag gis rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rnam pa lngas rtogs dka' bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should understand that the meaning of the absence of an agent, etc., is difficult to understand through the five aspects of complete arising from specific conditions.

original: rgyus rtogs dka' ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen por don gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: rgyus rtogs dka' ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen por don gnyis kyis so //
translated: The cause is difficult to understand because of the two topics that are antidotes to the proponents of a non-concordant cause and causelessness.

original: mchan nyid kyis rtogs dka' ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyi don gcig gis so //
analyzed: mchan nyid kyis rtogs dka' ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyi don gcig gis so //
translated: The nature is difficult to understand because of the single topic of the meaning of selflessness.

original: skye bas rtogs dka' ba'i rkyen rnams las 'bras bu 'byung yang des ma byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye bas rtogs dka' ba'i rkyen rnams las 'bras bu 'byung yang des ma byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The arising is difficult to understand because the result arises from the conditions, but it is not created by them.

original: don gnyis kyis so //ğŸ”½gnas pas rtogs dka' ba ni /
analyzed: don gnyis kyis so // gnas pas rtogs dka' ba ni /

original: rnam par gnas pa med kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te don gsum gyis so //ğŸ”½'byung bas rtogs par dka' ba ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba rnam par shes pa dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa med kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te don gsum gyis so // 'byung bas rtogs par dka' ba ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba rnam par shes pa dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: The appearance of abiding is due to the absence of abiding.ğŸ”½The occurrence is difficult to understand because of the four topics.

original: don bzhis so //
analyzed: don bzhis so //
translated: The occurrence of the result from the cause is difficult to understand.

original: yang rkyen so so las kun du skye ba skad cig ma yang yin la /
analyzed: yang rkyen so so las kun du skye ba skad cig ma yang yin la /
translated: Moreover, complete arising from specific conditions is momentary.

original: gnas par yang dmigs rkyen so so las kun du skye ba g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba yang yin la /ğŸ”½nus pa'i rkyen las byung bar yang dmigs /

translated: It is also seen that the mind arises from the condition of a specific object, and yet it arises from a condition that is not moving, that is, from the potential condition.

original: rkyen so so las kun du skye ba sems can med pa yang yin la sems can du yang dmigs /
analyzed: rkyen so so las kun du skye ba sems can med pa yang yin la sems can du yang dmigs /

analyzed: rkyen @162b so so las kun du skye ba byed pa po med pa yang yin la / las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar yang dmigs /

original: byed pa po med kyang las dang / byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yang yod de //
analyzed: byed pa po med kyang las dang / byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yang yod de //
translated: It is also seen that the mind arises from the condition of a specific object, and yet it is without a creator, and yet it is not the case that action and result are lost.

original: 'di ni 'dir las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar rig par bya'o // bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin /
translated: Here, action and result are not lost, even though there is no creator.ğŸ”½The mind is not produced from itself, nor from another, nor from both, nor without cause.

original: rang gi byed pa dang gzhan gyi byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi byed pa dang gzhan gyi byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not produced from its own action, nor from the action of another, nor without cause.

original: de'i phyir rtogs dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs dka'o //

original: chos ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ste /

original: gang gis byed pa de ma skyes te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis byed pa de ma skyes te med pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas pa ste /

original: gnyi gas kyang ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang ma byas pa ste /

original: rgyu de gnyis kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: rang gis byed pa dang / gzhan gyis byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin pa ni rkyen rnams 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It is not produced without a cause, because conditions are capable of producing effects.

original: rnams grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: rnams grangs gzhan du na /

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni rkyen yod kyang sa bon med na mi skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: gnyi gas ma byas pa ni de gnyi ga g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa ni sa bon dang rkyen rnams las nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa ni sa bon dang rkyen rnams las nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang rang gi sa bon las te gzhan las min /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi sa bon las te gzhan las min /

original: de la ltos phyir rang gis byas ma yin //

analyzed: g-yo ba med phyir gnyis kyis ma byas la //

original: de ni nus pas rgyu med 'byung ma yin /
analyzed: de ni nus pas rgyu med 'byung ma yin /

original: gang du mu bzhi char spang ba lta smos kying ci dgos te /
analyzed: gang du mu bzhi char spang ba lta smos kying ci dgos te /

analyzed: de bas na 'di mchog tu rtogs dka' bar rig par bya'o //

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / phyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang /

analyzed: zas kyis bsten pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pas 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu stobs kyi rab tu dbye bas kyang rab tu dbye bar blta @163a * //

analyzed: bar bya'o // rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The classification of the arising of consciousness is

translated: the statement, â€œConsciousness arises in dependence on name-and-form.â€

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The classification of death and rebirth is

analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: from the perspective of the world of sentient beings.

analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // phyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon la brten nas myu gu /
translated: It is the statement, â€œConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic processes.â€ğŸ”½The classification of the arising of external crops isğŸ”½the statement, â€œIn dependence on a seed, there is a sprout;

original: myu gu la brten nas sdong bu ste /
analyzed: myu gu la brten nas sdong bu ste /
translated: in dependence on a sprout, there is a stalk.â€

analyzed: de bzhin du sbu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rnams kyi sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The classification of dissolution and evolution is as follows:

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang la brten nas sa chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: zas kyis bsten pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas kyis bsten pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The classification of sustenance is as follows:

original: zas bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams khams gsum na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams khams gsum na gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni ;

analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'byung ba nas /

original: mthu stobs kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthu stobs kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The classification by power is as follows:

original: thos pa la brten nas mngon par zhes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa la brten nas mngon par zhes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba 'di dag gi 'du byed rnams rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba 'di dag gi 'du byed rnams rkyen so so las kun du skye ba rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the arising of formations from individual conditions should be understood in detail through these classifications.ğŸ”½How so?

original: rjes su mthun pa dang so sor mi mthun pas ji lta bu /

translated: By way of conformity and non-conformity.
