original: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa lta bu ni rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun par ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa lta bu ni rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun par ston to //
translated: In the same way, the statement, â€œWhen ignorance ceases, the conditioning factors cease,â€ etc., is a teaching that is in conformity with purification.

original: gang med na rga shi mi 'byung ba dang / gang 'gags na rga shi 'gag ces bya ba ni so sor mi mthun par ston to zhes pa lta bu ni rkyen so se las rab tu skyes par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang med na rga shi mi 'byung ba dang / gang 'gags na rga shi 'gag ces bya ba ni so sor mi mthun par ston to zhes pa lta bu ni rkyen so se las rab tu skyes par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The statement, â€œWhen this does not exist, that does not come to be; with the cessation of this, that ceases,â€ etc., is a teaching that is not in conformity with each of the members.

original: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All of them, with the exception of part of the element of mental objects and the sense-field of mental objects.

original: bdag la rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is without cause or with a cause that is not in conformity.

original: ji ltar na rkyen /
analyzed: ji ltar na rkyen /
translated: What is a condition?

original: rkyen rnams ni du /
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni du /
translated: How many are conditions?

original: ci'i phyir rkyen du brtag / rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag pos kyang rkyen du blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkyen du brtag / rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag pos kyang rkyen du blta bar bya'o ;
translated: With what aim is a condition investigated? A condition should be understood as cause, immediate relationship, objective support, and predominance.

original: / thams cad kyang rkyen no //
analyzed: / thams cad kyang rkyen no //
translated: All are conditions.

original: chos bdag gi rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag gi rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a self that is the cause of phenomena.

original: rgyu'i rkyen gang /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen gang /
translated: What is the causal condition?

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba'i bag chags so //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba'i bag chags so //
translated: It is the appropriating consciousness and the predispositions for the various representations.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams dang go rims so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams dang go rims so //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is the causal condition for the various representations that are defiled and undefiled, respectively.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The appropriating consciousness is twofold:

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from karmic ripening and that which arises from the formation of dispositions.

original: de la rnam par smin pa ni skye bas thob pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen no //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa ni skye bas thob pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen no //
translated: The causal condition for the representations that arise from karmic ripening is the consciousness that is obtained at birth.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyis te /
translated: The causal condition for the representations that arise from the formation of dispositions is the consciousness that arises from the formation of dispositions.

original: phyi ma len pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: phyi ma len pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rkyen du blta'o //
translated: The latter is to be understood as the causal condition for the other appropriating consciousnesses.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe de'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa kun du spyod pa'i bag chags bsgos par rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½dge ba'i bag chags ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa @164a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe de'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa kun du spyod pa'i bag chags bsgos par rig par bya'o // dge ba'i bag chags ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa @164a * //
translated: The appropriating consciousness that arises from the perfuming of the actualizing seeds should be understood as the perfuming of the habitual propensities of the consciousness that is active in the present life.

original: rnams kyi bag chags su blta bar bya ste //
analyzed: rnams kyi bag chags su blta bar bya ste //
translated: The habitual propensities of the good are to be seen as the habitual propensities of those who are fit for liberation.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they arise from the cause of the Dharma that is the natural outflow of the attainment of the supramundane.

original: de'i bag chags ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bag chags ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The habitual propensities of that are to be understood as the cause of the supramundane Dharma.

original: yang rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ; grogs dang / mthun par rtogs pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pas kyang rgyu'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ; grogs dang / mthun par rtogs pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pas kyang rgyu'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the causal condition should be understood in terms of its own nature, its differentiation, its companion, its realization in conformity, its increase, its obstruction, and its appropriation.

original: yang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu drug po dag rgyu'i rkyen du ston to //
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu drug po dag rgyu'i rkyen du ston to //
translated: Again, the six causes are shown to be the causal condition by the verse beginning with â€œown-being.â€

original: de la rang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni byed rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni byed rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the classification of own-being should be understood as the establishment of the active cause.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining terms should be understood as the establishment of the co-existent, the associated, the homogeneous, the pervasive, and the ripening causes, respectively.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi ji lta bu /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi ji lta bu /
translated: What is the own-being of the active cause?

original: byed rgyu ste rgyu rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: byed rgyu ste rgyu rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The active cause is the cause as own-being.

original: rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas byed pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas byed pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the own-being of the cause is taken as the basis, the active cause is established.

original: rgyu thams cad byed pa'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu thams cad byed pa'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that all causes are included in the active cause.

original: grogs la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir so sor rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: grogs la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir so sor rnam par gzhag go //
translated: However, they are established individually in order to demonstrate the distinctions of the companion, etc.

original: byed pa'i rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang bstan pa de ni dpe tsam du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang bstan pa de ni dpe tsam du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The classification of the causal condition should be understood as illustrated by the statement: â€œconsciousness arises from the causal condition of activity. â€

original: phyogs 'dis ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gzhan la yang mngon par brtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gzhan la yang mngon par brtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because other things of the same nature should be inferred by this method.

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it by classification?

original: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na mig la sogs pa tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na mig la sogs pa tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The productive cause is like the collection of eye, etc. , for consciousness.

original: de las 'bras bu ma byung ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu ma byung ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro // gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: Because the effect arises from that which has not yet arisen.

original: sems can 'byung po rnams dang / 'byung po tshol ba rnams kyi zas lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can 'byung po rnams dang / 'byung po tshol ba rnams kyi zas lta bu'o //
translated: The maintaining cause is like food for sentient beings and for those seeking to be sentient.

original: de'i stobs skye ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½brten pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: de'i stobs skye ba'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro // brten pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: Because it causes the stream of arising to continue without interruption.

original: sems can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: The supporting cause is like the earth for sentient beings.

original: ltung pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it prevents their falling.

original: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: The revealing cause is like the lamp for the pot, etc.

original: gzugs kyi sgron ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sgron ma lta bu'o //
translated: The illuminating cause is like a lamp.

original: bsgribs pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It illuminates the obscured.

original: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na shing gi mi lta bu'o //ğŸ”½de'i rgyud gzhan du @164b * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na shing gi mi lta bu'o // de'i rgyud gzhan du @164b * //
translated: The transforming cause is like a man made of wood.

original: 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro // 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: It causes the continuum to change into another state.

original: brda bar bya ba'i zor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: brda bar bya ba'i zor ba lta bu'o //
translated: The separating cause is like a sickle.

original: sbrel pa gnyis su med pa byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: sbrel pa gnyis su med pa byed pa'i phyir ro // bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: It separates the bound.

original: gser la sogs pa bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The changing cause is like gold and so on.

original: de'i cha shas yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i cha shas yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the parts to move to another place.

original: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na me'i du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na me'i du ba lta bu'o //
translated: The convincing cause is like smoke.

original: des lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: des lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro // yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: It causes one to infer the hidden.

original: sgrub pa'i dam bca' dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dam bca' dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams lta bu'o //
translated: The convincing cause is like a thesis, reason, and example.

original: des yang dag par nges par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des yang dag par nges par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the correct ascertainment of the truth.

original: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam lta bu'o //
translated: The causal condition is, for example, the path to nirvana.

original: des 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the attainment of nirvana.

original: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni dper na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni dper na /
translated: The conventional condition is, for example,

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: name, sign, and view.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin par mngon par zhin nas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin par mngon par zhin nas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one grasps the sign in accordance with the name, and then one conventionally designates.

original: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni gang la ltos nas gang don du gnyer ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni gang la ltos nas gang don du gnyer ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: The condition of dependence is that which is sought after in dependence on something else.

original: dper na bkres pa la ltos nas zas lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bkres pa la ltos nas zas lta bu'o //
translated: For example, food is sought after in dependence on hunger.

original: de la 'dod pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of desire for it.

original: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni rgyang ring ba'i rkyen te /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni rgyang ring ba'i rkyen te /
translated: The projecting condition is a remote condition.

original: dper na rga shi'i ma rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rga shi'i ma rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ignorance is the projecting condition of aging and death.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba gnas skabs gzhan du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba gnas skabs gzhan du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect arises from its cause, and it arises in a continuous series from one moment to the next.

original: mngon par grub pa'i byed rgyu ni nye ba'i rkyen te //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i byed rgyu ni nye ba'i rkyen te //
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is the active cause of the effect that is about to arise.

original: dper na 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ignorance is the active cause of the formations.

original: de ma thag tu 'byung ba skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'byung ba skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the effect that is about to arise.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen te ;
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen te ;
translated: The other conditions are the active cause of the effect that is being held.

original: dper na lo tog 'byung ba'i zhing dang chu dang / lung la sogs pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: dper na lo tog 'byung ba'i zhing dang chu dang / lung la sogs pa lta bu'o /
translated: For example, the field, water, fertilizer, etc. are the active cause of the crop.

original: rang gi sa bon las byung ba stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las byung ba stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the crop arises from its own seed and is nourished by them.

original: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni mthun pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni mthun pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The favorable condition is the active cause of the effect that is being brought about.

original: dper na rgyal po mnyes par bya ba'i rgyal po la legs par brten pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po mnyes par bya ba'i rgyal po la legs par brten pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the king is the active cause of the satisfaction of one who is well established in the kingâ€™s favor.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa 'gugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa 'gugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he attracts to himself those who are favorable to him.

original: so sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni de rkyen sna tshogs te /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni de rkyen sna tshogs te /
translated: The various conditions are the active cause of the effect that is determined.

original: dper na 'gro ba lnga po dag gis 'gro ba lnga'i rkyen lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba lnga po dag gis 'gro ba lnga'i rkyen lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the five kinds of beings are like the conditions for the five destinies.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pas 'bras bu gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pas 'bras bu gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the different natures produce different effects.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ni rkyen tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ni rkyen tshogs pa ste /
translated: The cooperative cause is the collection of conditions.

original: dper na rnam par @165a * //
analyzed: dper na rnam par @165a * //
translated: For example,

original: shes pa'i dbang po ma nyams pa dang / yul yang snang ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang po ma nyams pa dang / yul yang snang ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: the unimpaired sense organ, the appearance of the object, and the presence of attention that generates consciousness.

original: rang gi 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not depend on another cause to establish its own effect.

original: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste dper na lo tog la ser ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste dper na lo tog la ser ba lta bu'o //
translated: The counteragent cause is that which obstructs, for example, hail is for a crop.

original: gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it creates an obstacle.

original: mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste dper na bar chad byed med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste dper na bar chad byed med pa lta bu'o //
translated: The non-counteragent cause is that which does not obstruct, for example, the absence of an obstacle.

original: de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the opposite of the above.

original: grogs kyi ji lta bu chos gang dag grogs yod na 'byung gi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: grogs kyi ji lta bu chos gang dag grogs yod na 'byung gi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Those phenomena that arise when a friend is present, but not when any one of them is absent.ğŸ”½For example, the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar gyi tshogs pa thams cad dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar gyi tshogs pa thams cad dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin
translated: The primary elements and the derivative form arise together, but not all derivative form arises from the four primary elements.

original: no // de'i phyir gang na gang yod pa de ni de de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: no // de'i phyir gang na gang yod pa de ni de de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever exists in a certain place arises together with that which exists there.

original: gang la rung ba zhig med na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la rung ba zhig med na ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not arise when any one of them is absent.

original: mthun par rtogs pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the case of a companion?

original: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi /
translated: Those phenomena that are companions, that are understood to have a common objective support,

original: gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: but not when any one of them is absent.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: For example, mind and the mental factors.

original: de ltar grogs su nges pa la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar grogs su nges pa la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the simultaneous cause is established in order to determine the companion.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The elements and the derivative form are mentioned

original: dper brjod pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper brjod pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: as an example.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gang yang tung ba zhig med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gal te de ltar na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu logs shig tu gzhag tu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gang yang tung ba zhig med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro // gal te de ltar na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu logs shig tu gzhag tu med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is certain that the mind and mental factors do not occur without each other.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then the concomitant cause cannot be posited separately because the mind and mental factors are included in the simultaneous cause.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang don gzhan gyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang don gzhan gyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Even though that is so, they become concomitant causes by a different meaning.

original: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ni ma yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ni ma yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Because those phenomena that are concomitant causes realize the same focal object and if any one is incomplete, they are not concomitant causes.

original: des na lhan cig 'byung ba tsam ni /
analyzed: des na lhan cig 'byung ba tsam ni /
translated: Thus, co-existence is the fact of being together.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: mind and mental activities.

original: rgyas pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rgyas pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is development?

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge @165b ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams goms pa rnams phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge @165b ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams goms pa rnams phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that, in the future, good, bad, and unobscurednondefined previously cultivated natures will appear in a more and more advanced state, in a most advanced state.

original: sngon goms par byas pa rnams te /
analyzed: sngon goms par byas pa rnams te /
translated: They are previously cultivated natures.

original: sngon kun du spyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon kun du spyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression previously practiced is synonymous with previously cultivated.

original: phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the future, they will appear in a more and more advanced state, in a most advanced state.

original: de dag gis sngon yongs su gsos pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dag gis sngon yongs su gsos pa rnams te /
translated: They are previously nourished natures.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyad par can du 'byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyad par can du 'byung bar blta'o //
translated: One should understand that, in the future, they will appear in a superior state, because they have arisen from a superior cause.

original: de ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyas par byed pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyas par byed pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, homogeneous cause is the cause that nourishes similar dharmas.

original: bar du gcod pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the cause of obstruction?

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud thag ba sring ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba'i rgyun rgyas par ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud thag ba sring ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba'i rgyun rgyas par ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause that nourishes the stream of any defilement in order to prolong the series of existences in the realm of rebirths and to prevent the attainment of nirvÄá¹‡a.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni 'dra bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni 'dra bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The universal cause is not only the cause that nourishes similar dharmas.

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba goms pas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun kyang rgyas par bstan par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba goms pas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun kyang rgyas par bstan par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, by the practice of any defilement, such as attachment, the stream of any other defilement, such as hatred, is nourished.

original: de'i phyir dam du 'ching bar byed pas na thar pa thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam du 'ching bar byed pas na thar pa thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of obstruction, because it binds tightly and prevents the attainment of liberation.

original: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the universal cause is to be understood.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the cause of possession?

original: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.ğŸ”½It is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni phyi ma las gcig tu mi 'dra ba ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston par lus su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni phyi ma las gcig tu mi 'dra ba ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston par lus su bsdus pa ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.

original: rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go //ğŸ”½dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bzung ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go // dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bzung ba ni /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyis ni zag pa skye ba dang / mi mthun pas 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ma thag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyis ni zag pa skye ba dang / mi mthun pas 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de ma thag pas ji lta bu /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the unobscured-non-defined factor that is not similar to the effect, which is included in the category of the body.ğŸ”½The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation because it projects the effect.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is established as the cause of karmic maturation because it is the cause of the effect that is similar to the cause.ğŸ”½The

original: de la rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa ni gdon mi za bar skad cig gi bar med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa ni gdon mi za bar skad cig gi bar med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Uninterrupted means without a break.

original: 'on kyang sems gzhan gyi bar chad med pa yang 'dir bar chad med par blta bar bya ste /ğŸ”½gzhan @166a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems gzhan gyi bar chad med pa yang 'dir bar chad med par blta bar bya ste / gzhan @166a * //
translated: But here, uninterrupted means without interruption by another mind.

original: du na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni sems med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i snyoms 'jug gi sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur bar rigs na 'gyur bas /
analyzed: du na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni sems med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i snyoms 'jug gi sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur bar rigs na 'gyur bas /
translated: Otherwise, when a mind of meditative attainment arises from a mind of entry to meditative attainment, the mind of meditative attainment would not be the immediately preceding condition of the mind of entry to meditative attainment.

original: de'i phyir rgyud gcig la phyi ma'i sems dang snga ma'i sems kyi bar du sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud gcig la phyi ma'i sems dang snga ma'i sems kyi bar du sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Therefore the immediately preceding condition is the mind of the latter meditative attainment that is not obstructed by another mind between it and the mind of the former meditative attainment within a single mindstream.

original: sems la ji lta bar sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems la ji lta bar sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is for minds, so it is for mental factors.

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las sems dang sems las byung ba'i de ma thag pas zhes bya ba la sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba rnams ni mthun pa'i dge ba rnams kyi dang / mi mthun pa mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las sems dang sems las byung ba'i de ma thag pas zhes bya ba la sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba rnams ni mthun pa'i dge ba rnams kyi dang / mi mthun pa mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The wholesome minds and mental factors are the immediately preceding condition for the arising of wholesome minds and mental factors that are homogeneous and heterogeneous, for unwholesome minds and mental factors, and for the immediately following unobscured-neutral minds and mental factors.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang rang gzhan gyi rnam pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang rang gzhan gyi rnam pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the unwholesome and obscured-neutral minds and mental factors should be applied to their own and others' types.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: Similarly, the minds and mental factors of the desire realm are the immediately preceding condition for the arising of the minds and mental factors of the desire realm, the form realm, the formless realm, and the uncontaminated immediately after them.

original: de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa yang so sor gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa yang so sor gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, the form realm and so on are the immediately preceding condition of the form realm and so on, and the desire realm and so on that arise immediately after.

original: ci sems thams cad kyi de ma thag tu sems thams cad 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: ci sems thams cad kyi de ma thag tu sems thams cad 'byung ba'am /
translated: Does any mind arise immediately after any mind?

original: 'on te nges pa yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa yod ce na /
translated: Or is there a rule?

original: nges pa yod ces bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa yod ces bya ste /
translated: There is a rule.

original: sems 'di'i 'og tu sems 'di dang 'di 'byung ngo zhes brjod na ni brjod pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems 'di'i 'og tu sems 'di dang 'di 'byung ngo zhes brjod na ni brjod pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If we were to say that this mind is immediately followed by this or that mind, there would be too many statements.

original: de lta bas na phyir sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyir sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag go /
translated: Therefore, the mere characteristics of the arising of minds are presented.

original: 'di ltar stobs bcus sems 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs bcus sems 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the arising of minds should be understood through the ten powers.

original: 'dris pa'i stobs dang / 'dun pa'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs dang / 'phen pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i stobs dang / 'dun pa'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs dang / 'phen pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis so //
translated: the power of acquaintance, the power of will, the power of application, the power of concentration, the power of projection, the power of cause, the power of object, the power of mindfulness, the power of attention, and the power of linking.

original: 'dris pa'i stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The power of acquaintance is threefold:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pa'o //
translated: small, middling, and great.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rgyu @166b rnams mi mngon pa'i phyir chung ngu'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rgyu @166b rnams mi mngon pa'i phyir chung ngu'o //
translated: It is small when the causes of entering, abiding in, and rising from concentration are not manifest.

original: mngon pa legs par ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'bring po'o //
analyzed: mngon pa legs par ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'bring po'o //
translated: It is middling when one is not well acquainted with the manifest.

original: legs par 'dris pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: legs par 'dris pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: It is great when one is well acquainted with the manifest.

original: de la 'dris pa chung ngu'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams la mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dris pa chung ngu'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams la mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that by the power of small acquaintance, one enters the concentrations and formless states in succession.

original: 'bring ni gcig gis bar du chod pa'i tshul gyis thong rgal du snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'bring ni gcig gis bar du chod pa'i tshul gyis thong rgal du snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: The medium type enters meditative attainment by skipping over one stage.

original: chen pos ni ji ltar 'dod pa'am thams cad la thod rgal du zhugs nas lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chen pos ni ji ltar 'dod pa'am thams cad la thod rgal du zhugs nas lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great type enters meditative attainment by skipping over any stage, either in forward order or in reverse order, as desired.

original: 'dun pa'i stobs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs la /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i stobs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs la /
translated: The power of intention is as follows: One who has attained the second meditative absorption enters meditative attainment in the first meditative absorption.

original: gal te 'dod na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa las ldang ba'i sems mngon du byed do //ğŸ”½gzhan du 'dod na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa de dge ba'am /
analyzed: gal te 'dod na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa las ldang ba'i sems mngon du byed do // gzhan du 'dod na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa de dge ba'am /
translated: If one wishes, one manifests an awareness that is ready to arise in the second meditative absorption.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed do //
translated: If one wishes otherwise, one manifests an awareness that is either wholesome or unobscured-neutral in the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied extensively to the other meditative absorptions.

original: sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba nyid kyi mjug thogs su thog ma kho nar gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba nyid kyi mjug thogs su thog ma kho nar gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ngo //
translated: By the power of application, a form realm mind arises immediately after a desire realm virtuous mind for the first time.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind of unrestricted access concentration, the actual basis arises.

original: dngos gzhi'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgya cher srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgya cher srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: Immediately after the actual basis, the preparation of the second absorption arises and so on, up to the peak of existence.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of meditative equipoise,

original: dag pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems res 'ga' ni dag pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: dag pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems res 'ga' ni dag pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: sometimes two pure minds arise from a pure mind that is equipoise.

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Sometimes an afflicted mind arises.

original: 'phen pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rgyu ba na /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rgyu ba na /
translated: By the power of projection, when one moves after rising from concentration,

original: ji srid du de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas yongs su nyams par ma gyur ba de srid du mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i skad cig 'dren par rjes su 'jug go //ğŸ”½de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni rgyu ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kun du 'byung bar rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½de la rgyu'i stobs kyis ni gal te gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa sngon bsags par gyur pa'o //ğŸ”½yul gyi stobs kyis ni 'dod @167a * //
analyzed: ji srid du de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas yongs su nyams par ma gyur ba de srid du mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i skad cig 'dren par rjes su 'jug go // de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni rgyu ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kun du 'byung bar rig par bya'o // de la rgyu'i stobs kyis ni gal te gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa sngon bsags par gyur pa'o // yul gyi stobs kyis ni 'dod @167a * //
translated: As long as he has not fallen away from that attainment by the arising of a counteragent, he continues to experience the mind of the stage of meditative concentration and the mind of the stage of nonconcentrated equipoise.ğŸ”½The mind associated with the counteragent should be understood as arising through the power of cause, etc.ğŸ”½Through the power of cause, if there is an obstruction previously accumulated that necessarily causes a fall.ğŸ”½Through the power of object, if one is not skilled in the object.ğŸ”½

original: chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa sdug pa la sogs pa mtshan ma'i stobs shas che ba'i yul snang bar gyur pa'o //ğŸ”½dran pa'i stobs kyis ni /

original: gal te dran pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis 'das pa'i yul la 'phros par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dran pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis 'das pa'i yul la 'phros par byed pa'o //
translated: If it is asked by what power, it is by the power of memory, because it is the proliferation of the mind to the object of the past through the conceptualization of memory.

original: yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te spyod pa'i yid la byed pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te spyod pa'i yid la byed pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: If it is asked by what power, it is by the power of attention, because it is the attention of the mind to any sign of beauty.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni gsar du 'chi ba'i sems rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni gsar du 'chi ba'i sems rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: If it is asked by what power, it is by the power of linking, because it is the nine types of mind of death.

original: lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i khams gsum du so sor 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i khams gsum du so sor 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag go //
translated: It is the craving for the body that is concomitant with the three realms, individually, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: If it is asked from where, it is from the desire realm.ğŸ”½If it is asked where, it is in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is asked what, it is the craving for the body that is concomitant with the mind of death.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su shi 'phos nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su shi 'phos nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind that dies in the realm of desire and is reborn in the realm of form or the formless realm is the mind of death in the realm of form or the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid dang gzhan du skye ba'i sems kyang drug tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid dang gzhan du skye ba'i sems kyang drug tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind that dies in the realm of form or the formless realm and is reborn in the same realm or another realm is to be connected with the six categories.

original: yul la sred pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / dmigs pa la mi spyod pa dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sred pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / dmigs pa la mi spyod pa dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This craving for the object is innate, does not operate on the object, and is obscured neutral.

original: lus dang lhan cig skyes pa 'di'i dmigs pa rnam pa yongs su mi gcod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang lhan cig skyes pa 'di'i dmigs pa rnam pa yongs su mi gcod par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the innate body does not completely eliminate the object.

original: de'i dbang gis de ma thag pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni bar ma dor srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de ma thag pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni bar ma dor srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: By its power, ordinary beings are reborn in the intermediate state.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'chi ba'i dus ji srid du 'du shes mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su ma gyur pa de srid du srid pa de kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'chi ba'i dus ji srid du 'du shes mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su ma gyur pa de srid du srid pa de kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: Noble ones who are not detached from the realm of desire, as long as they have not entered the state of nonidentification, manifest this existence at the time of death, to the extent that their ideation is not yet disturbed.

original: de dag ni de yongs su rtogs nas gnyen por tshar gcod do //
analyzed: de dag ni de yongs su rtogs nas gnyen por tshar gcod do //
translated: But when they have fully understood it, they destroy it by means of the antidote.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma spangs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs che bas kun du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma spangs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs che bas kun du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Noble ones who are detached from the realm of desire do not manifest this existence, even though they have not abandoned it, because the power of the antidote is strong.

original: de'i pa gal nyal gyi dbang gis ni nyid mtshams su sbyor ro //ğŸ”½bar ma do'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma ni /
analyzed: de'i pa gal nyal gyi dbang gis ni nyid mtshams su sbyor ro // bar ma do'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma ni /
translated: But by the power of their vow, they are reborn.

original: rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid de rnam par smin pa yin @167b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid de rnam par smin pa yin @167b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment of conception in the intermediate existence is always a nonobscurednondefined state, because it is a ripened effect.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: After that, it is either wholesome, unwholesome, or nondefined, according to the case.

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: But this does not apply to the mind at death.

original: bar ma do'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: bar ma do'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: The mind of death and the mind of birth are always non-defined.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa bzhin no //
translated: The mind of death is always non-defined, like the existence at death.

original: skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind of birth is always non-defined and non-obscured.

original: byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba rnams kyi 'chi ba'i sems la sogs pa thams cad kyang gcig tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba rnams kyi 'chi ba'i sems la sogs pa thams cad kyang gcig tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind of death and so on of bodhisattvas who are born through the power of aspiration are known as virtuous.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the immediately preceding condition is complete.

original: // / dmigs pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: // / dmigs pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the object?

original: yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang /
translated: The object is of ten kinds: the object that is a limited domain, the object that is an unlimited domain, the object that is not a domain of form, the object that is a domain of form, the object that is a domain of the past, the object that is a domain of the future, the object that is a domain of the present, the object that is a domain of the unconditioned, the object that is a domain of the conditioned, and the object that is a domain of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: dngos po med ba'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med ba'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The objective condition should be understood as the object of the five groups of consciousness, the object of the mental consciousness, the object of the non-existent thing, the object of the imagined thing, the object of error, the object of non-error, the object with resistance, and the object without resistance.

original: de la yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gis dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gis dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of the five groups of consciousness is called the object of the undetermined field,

original: rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of the five groups of consciousness is determined individually.

original: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of mental consciousness is called the object of the undetermined field,

original: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because all things are the object of mental consciousness.

original: yul bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the five groups of consciousness is called the object of the non-grasping of the variegated,ğŸ”½because the five groups of consciousness do not grasp the variegated.

original: ming la ma byang ba rnams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ming la ma byang ba rnams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have not yet learned to read is a name.

original: ming las yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming las yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro // yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because one cannot make a letter out of a name.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.

original: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.

original: lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan bdag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan bdag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½ma gtogs @168a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni / ma gtogs @168a * //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.

original: pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /ğŸ”½bdag gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste / bdag gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.

original: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to read is a letter.ğŸ”½The object of the mental consciousness of those who have learned to

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams dang / sa gzhan la ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhi gtan la 'bebs pa med pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //ğŸ”½kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams dang / sa gzhan la ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhi gtan la 'bebs pa med pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o // kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni / ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of the imagined is the object of those that are excluded.

original: rang gis kun brtags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½phyin ci log gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gis kun brtags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // phyin ci log gi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the object of those that are excluded because it is the object of mere imagination by itself.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //ğŸ”½phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The object of the erroneous is the object of those that arise in the aspect of permanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //ğŸ”½thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the non-erroneous is the object of those that arise in the aspect of impermanence, etc.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the obstructed is the object of those who have not abandoned the obscurations to the known.ğŸ”½The object of the unobstructed is the object of those who have abandoned the obscurations to the known.

original: thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the unimpeded is also to be regarded as the objective condition.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the object of those who have eliminated the obscurations to knowledge.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par nges pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par nges pa ni /
translated: The determination of the objective condition is as follows:

original: mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / gzhag pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pas kyang dmigs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / gzhag pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pas kyang dmigs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The object should be understood as being determined by way of its characteristic, its differentiation, its establishment, its comprehension, and its abandonment.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by way of its characteristic?

original: don gang der snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / de dag byung nas kyang don de la mngon bar zhen pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don gang der snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / de dag byung nas kyang don de la mngon bar zhen pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The object is the cause of the occurrence of mind and mental activities that appear as that object, and, having occurred, they adhere to that object, designate it, and understand it individually. This is the characteristic of the object.

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /ğŸ”½med pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na / med pa'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: How is it by way of its differentiation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The nonexistent object is as follows:ğŸ”½The nonexistent object is of two kinds:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the mind and mental activities that are erroneous, the object of the past, future, dreams, reflections, magical creations, etc.

original: yod pa dag gi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa dag gi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object of what exists is

original: de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of what is other than that.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object of the absence of an object is

analyzed: gzugs dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: form, the nonassociated formative forces, and the unconditioned.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object of what possesses an object is

analyzed: sems dang sems las @168b byung ba'i chos rnams so //

original: yang dag pa nyid du dmigs pa ni /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du dmigs pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of reality is

analyzed: dge ba'o // log pa nyid du dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: such as virtue. The object of unreality is

original: nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: such as the passions.

analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ma yin la log pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of what is neither real nor unreal is

analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: such as the unobscured indeterminate.

original: tshul bzhin gyi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object of what is proper is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dge ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of what is improper is as follows:

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi dmigs pa'o // tshul bzhin ma yin la /

analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni /

analyzed: 'dra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi dge ba la sogs pa dang / rang gis pa rnams kyi rang gi pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The wholesome factors, etc. have wholesome factors, etc. as their object; those that are of the same level have those of the same level as their object; those that are associated with impurity have those that are associated with impurity as their object; those that are dissociated from impurity have those that are dissociated from impurity as their object.

original: mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / sa pa gzhan rnams kyi sa pa gzhan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / sa pa gzhan rnams kyi sa pa gzhan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The object of the same stage is the object of the wholesome, unwholesome, non-defined, etc. , of those belonging to the same stage, of those belonging to another stage, of those associated with impurity, and of those associated with purity.

analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

original: gcig pu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig pu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mi rtog mi dpyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

original: 'bral ba med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'bral ba med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste ;

analyzed: 'bral ba ni med par gyur pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan dun 'bral ba chen po nyid la bya'o //

original: bsdus pa phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi dmigs pa'o // mthar phyin pa phra ba'i dmigs pa ni /

analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½mdo @169a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya'o // mdo @169a * //

analyzed: don gyi dmigs pa ni de la brten pa brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //

original: chung du'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chung du'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rgya chen po'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: theg pa chen po'o //

analyzed: mtshan ma'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of signs is as follows:

analyzed: zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams so //

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa ni /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa ni / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: nirvana and the summit of existence.

original: de kho na'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang rnam pa bcu drug po dag gi dmigs pa bden pa rnams so //

analyzed: gnas par bya ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: dbang bsgyur ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

original: skad cig ma'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi tshe de nyid do //

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //

original: gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: rnam pa bzhi yongs su 'grub pa'i dmigs par rig par bya'o //

original: rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang / bsgribs pa med par yang phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba dang / shes pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par 'gyur bas so //

translated: The consciousness is the cause of the non-concordant, the object of the non-existent consciousness, the non-obstructed, the non-inverted, and the concordant with the three knowledges.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub pa'o //

original: shes pa rnam pa gsum ni dbang gi shes pa dang / lhag mthong gi shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gsum ni dbang gi shes pa dang / lhag mthong gi shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //

original: de la rnam pa bzhi'i dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi'i dper brjod pa ni /

analyzed: yi dgas dud 'gro mi rnams dang // lha rnams ji ltar ris ris su //

original: dngos gcig yid ni @169b tha dad phyir //
analyzed: dngos gcig yid ni @169b tha dad phyir //

original: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin //
translated: It is asserted that the object is not established.ğŸ”½The past and so forth, and likewise dreams,

original: 'das sogs de bzhin rmi lam dang // gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis po yang //
analyzed: 'das sogs de bzhin rmi lam dang // gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis po yang //

analyzed: med phyir dmigs pa med pa'i phyir //

original: de ni dmigs par rung ba yin //
analyzed: de ni dmigs par rung ba yin //
translated: They are suitable to be observed.

original: don ni don du 'grub gyur na //
analyzed: don ni don du 'grub gyur na //
translated: If the object were to be established as an object,

original: shes pa rtog pa med mi 'gyur //ğŸ”½de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: shes pa rtog pa med mi 'gyur // de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: The cognition would not be non-conceptual.ğŸ”½Because of that, it is not tenable

original: thob par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: To attain buddhahood.ğŸ”½For the bodhisattvas who have attained mastery

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // rnal 'byor pa la 'di ltar yang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // rnal 'byor pa la 'di ltar yang //
translated: And for the yogis, in the same way,

original: mos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs //
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs //
translated: By the power of aspiration, things like earth

original: dngos po de ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po de ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Are observed in that way.ğŸ”½Here, for those who have attained discernment,

original: 'di la rnam par 'byed grub dang // blo ldan zhi ba thob pa yi //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par 'byed grub dang // blo ldan zhi ba thob pa yi //
translated: And for the wise who have attained peace,

original: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
analyzed: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
translated: In the mental engagement with all phenomena,

original: de ltar don ni mi snang phyir //
analyzed: de ltar don ni mi snang phyir //
translated: Because the object does not appear in that way,

original: mi rtogs shes pa rgyu ba la /
analyzed: mi rtogs shes pa rgyu ba la /
translated: The non-conceptual cognition does not arise.

original: don kun snang ba med phyir yang //
analyzed: don kun snang ba med phyir yang //
translated: Also, because all objects do not appearğŸ”½To the non-conceptual cognition,

original: don med khong du chud par bya //
analyzed: don med khong du chud par bya //

original: de med pas na rnam rig med //
analyzed: de med pas na rnam rig med //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no representation.

original: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na //

analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / gzhag pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: spong bas ji lta bu zhe na /

original: nyan thos dang / theg pa chen po gnas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / theg pa chen po gnas gyur pa ste /

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa gnas gyur pas ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa gnas gyur pas ni /

original: theg pa chen po gnas gyur pas ni //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gnas gyur pas ni //

original: gnyi ga'o // dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gnyi ga'o // dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /

original: // / bdag pos ji lta bu //
analyzed: // / bdag pos ji lta bu //

analyzed: de la rten la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the first,

analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rten la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: the circle of wind exercises mastery with regard to the support of the circle of water, etc.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi'o //ğŸ”½'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi'o // 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The physical world exercises mastery with regard to the world of sentient beings.

original: dbang po rnams ni rnam par @170a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni rnam par @170a * //
translated: The primary elements exercise mastery with regard to the derivative form.ğŸ”½The faculties exercise mastery with regard to the various distinctions of sentient beings.

original: shes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: of the consciousnesses.

original: 'phen pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phen pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Dominance in projecting is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi snod kyi 'jig rten 'phen pa la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi snod kyi 'jig rten 'phen pa la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The world-receptacle, which is the common karma of all sentient beings, is projected by the karma of a single sentient being.

original: sngon gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The karma of a previous life is the cause of the present result.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la sems ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
