analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la sems ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: Dominance in co-arising is as follows: The mind is the dominant condition of the mental factors in co-arising.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi'o //
translated: Attention is the dominant condition of the mind.

original: reg pa ni tshor ba'i'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½'di man chad ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni tshor ba'i'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'di man chad ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du bya ste /
translated: Contact is the dominant condition of feeling.

original: bdag por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the twenty-two faculties are to be understood as being presented as dominant conditions.

original: de la yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Dominance in the object is as follows:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, and the mind faculty.

original: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their influence, form and so on are actualized.

original: skye bar dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: skye bar dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
translated: The faculties of masculinity and femininity are called the controlling faculties for the distinction of sex.

original: de'i dbang gis mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their influence, one enters the womb.

original: gnas par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: gnas par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ste /
translated: The life faculty is called the controlling faculty for remaining alive.

original: de'i dbang gis ris mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis ris mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro // 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of its influence, one remains alive in a homogeneous collection.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: The faculties of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and indifference are called the controlling faculties for experiencing the results of the past actions.

original: de'i dbang gis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their influence, one experiences the agreeable and disagreeable results of past actions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five faculties beginning with faith are called the controlling faculties for the purification of one's own continuum.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: the faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called faculties because they control the subjugation of the addictions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The faculties of the supramundane pure state are to be known as the faculty of the conviction about the possibility of attaining purity, the faculty of the awareness of purity, and the faculty of the possession of the awareness of purity.

original: de dag gis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs /
analyzed: de dag gis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs /
translated: They are called faculties because they control the thorough destruction of the instinct for the addictions.ğŸ”½What is the same support? What is the same object?

original: rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs rnams ni du /
analyzed: rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs rnams ni du /
translated: How many are the same support and the same object?

original: ci'i phyir rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs su brtag / rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i yul la rgyun du 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang @170b bral zhing de dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas kyang rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs su brtag / rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i yul la rgyun du 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang @170b bral zhing de dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas kyang rten mtshungs dang de mtshungs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as homogeneous and partially homogeneous because they are not separated from consciousness and they are similar to it, and because they are separated from consciousness and they are similar to it.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang / skye mched lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang / skye mched lnga'o //
translated: One part of the form aggregate, the five material elements and the five material sense bases.

original: rnam par shes ba dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rten pa mtshungs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rten pa mtshungs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase â€œnot separated from consciousness and they are similar to it, and because they are separated from consciousness and they are similar to itâ€ should be understood as homogeneous.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan zhing rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i yul rnam la de rgyun du 'byung zhing rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan zhing rnam par shes pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i yul rnam la de rgyun du 'byung zhing rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with consciousness and they are similar to consciousness, and because they are the objects of the sense faculties that are similar to consciousness, and because they are similar to the arising of consciousness.

original: dbang po de ni rten pa mtshungs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dbang po de ni rten pa mtshungs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This faculty is called â€œsimilar and supporting.â€

original: gnyis pa rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing de dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni de mtshungs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing de dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni de mtshungs te /
translated: The second is similar and continuous, being devoid of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po'i bdag nyid dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung zhing dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir de mtshungs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po'i bdag nyid dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung zhing dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir de mtshungs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the similar is similar to the faculty itself, which is devoid of consciousness, and is continuous, because it is similar to the characteristics of the faculty.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: One part of the aggregates is the five faculties, such as the eye, etc.

original: gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga ni mig la sogs pa de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga ni mig la sogs pa de rnams nyid do //
translated: The five elements and spheres of form are the same as those faculties, such as the eye, etc.

original: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with a view to abandoning attachment to a self provided with or devoid of consciousness.ğŸ”½How many are appropriated?

original: ji ltar na zin pa zin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na zin pa zin pa rnams ni du /
translated: Which are appropriated?

original: ci'i phyir zin par brtag / tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs ni zin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zin par brtag / tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs ni zin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Why is it considered to be appropriated?ğŸ”½The form that is the basis for the arising of feeling is to be regarded as appropriated.

original: gzugs gang la brten nas tshor ba 'byung ba de ni zin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs gang la brten nas tshor ba 'byung ba de ni zin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The form that is the basis for the arising of feeling is called appropriated.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is part of the form heap and is included in the sense bases and elements that have form.

original: khams dang skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five sense bases and elements that have form are the eye, etc.

original: bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is part of four of the heaps.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dbang po las gzhan du ma gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dbang po las gzhan du ma gyur ba'o //
translated: It is form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible that are not included in the sense faculties.

original: bdag lus la dbang bsgyur ba mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag lus la dbang bsgyur ba mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is to abandon attachment to the self as that which controls the body.

original: ji ltar na dbang po dang / dbang po rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang po dang / dbang po rnams ni du /
translated: What is a faculty? How many are faculties?ğŸ”½With what aim is a faculty investigated?

original: ci'i phyir dbang por brtag / yul 'dzin par dbang byed pa dang / rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa dang / ris mthun par gnas par dbang byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang por brtag / yul 'dzin par dbang byed pa dang / rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa dang / ris mthun par gnas par dbang byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang /
translated: objects, over the purity of the spiritual life, and over the attainmentğŸ”½of the two higher realms.ğŸ”½They are called faculties because they exercise control over theğŸ”½perception of objects, over the continuity of the species, over remaining in oneâ€™s own stage, over enjoying virtuous and nonvirtuousğŸ”½actions, over the purity of the spiritual life, and over the attainment

original: 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pas kyang dbang por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pas kyang dbang por blta bar bya'o //
translated: of the two higher realms.

original: @171a * // de la yul 'dzin par byed pa ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: @171a * // de la yul 'dzin par byed pa ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: The six faculties of eye, etc., exercise control over the perceptionğŸ”½of objects, because the mind and mental factors apprehend form, etc.,

original: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa la sems dang sems las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa la sems dang sems las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa ni /
translated: through their power.

original: pho dang mo'i dang po ste /
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dang po ste /
translated: The first two faculties exercise control over the continuity of theğŸ”½species, because the continuity of the species is produced through

original: de las bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: them.ğŸ”½The faculty of life exercises control over remaining in oneâ€™s ownğŸ”½stage, because it is the support for the duration of the aggregates ofğŸ”½a particular stage.

original: lhag ma ni bdag po'i rkyen du bstan pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bdag po'i rkyen du bstan pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The remaining conditions should be understood in the same way as the dominant condition.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / pho dang / mo'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / pho dang / mo'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of consciousness, one part of the aggregate of form, one part of the aggregate of formations, the characteristics of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, male and female faculties,

original: srog gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang go rims so //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang go rims so //
translated: the characteristics of the life faculty, and the faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / dbang po dang / rnams par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / nang gi rnams so //
analyzed: khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / dbang po dang / rnams par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / nang gi rnams so //
translated: The twelve elements, six sense bases, elements of the faculties and consciousness, and the internal ones.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The element of mental objects and one part of the sense base of mental objects.

original: srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The life faculty, the five beginning with pleasure, and the five beginning with faith.

original: bdag dbang byed par mngon pa zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dbang byed par mngon pa zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the attachment to the self as the master.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid /
translated: What is the suffering of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal rnams ni du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal rnams ni du /
translated: How many are suffering of suffering?ğŸ”½With what aim is the suffering of suffering investigated?

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering should be understood as the suffering of the essential nature of suffering and the suffering of being confronted with what is unpleasant.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni /
translated: Therein, the suffering of the essential nature of suffering is

original: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: the suffering that is the essential nature of suffering.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: It is the suffering of suffering because of its essential nature.

original: de 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur ba dbang po dang / don rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur ba dbang po dang / don rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The suffering of being confronted with what is unpleasant is the suffering that arises from the sense faculties and their objects, and from that which is associated with them, because of the experience of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering is to be seen as the suffering of suffering itself.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is a part of all.

original: bdag sdug bsngal bar mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal bar mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the idea that suffering is pleasant.ğŸ”½What is the suffering of change?

original: ji ltar na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid /ğŸ”½'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rnams ni du /
translated: The suffering of change is of how many kinds?ğŸ”½For what reason is the suffering of change investigated? The suffering of change is to be seen as the suffering of change itself, as the suffering of change of that which is pleasant, and as the suffering of change of the mind associated with that.

original: ci'i phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba rang @171b gi mtshan nyid dang / de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba rang @171b gi mtshan nyid dang / de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The suffering of change of the pleasant is the suffering that arises from the change of pleasant feeling and of the things that cause pleasant feeling.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de mong bar byed pa'i chos rnams 'gyur bas yid mi bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de mong bar byed pa'i chos rnams 'gyur bas yid mi bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The suffering of change of the mind associated with that is the suffering that arises from the change of the mind associated with that pleasant feeling and those things that cause pleasant feeling.

original: de 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //ğŸ”½de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //ğŸ”½de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering that arises from the change of the pleasant and of the things that cause pleasant feeling.ğŸ”½The suffering of change of the mind associated with that is the suffering that arises from the change of the mind associated with that pleasant feeling and those things that cause pleasant feeling.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: The suffering of change should be understood as the suffering of the pleasant.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gnas 'gyur ba'i sems kyis zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas 'gyur ba'i sems kyis zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said: â€œwith a mind that is changeable.â€

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is a part of all three.

original: bdag bde bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid /
analyzed: bdag bde bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self at ease.ğŸ”½How many kinds of suffering of the formative forces are there?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du /
translated: How many are suffering of the formative forces?ğŸ”½With what aim is the suffering of the formative forces investigated?

original: ci'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The own-characteristic of the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, and the own-characteristic of the dharmas that are experienced as neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyi ga las mthar ba mi rtag pa nyid kyis rjes su bcings par grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pas kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½de la sdug bsngal yang ma yin /ğŸ”½bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyi ga las mthar ba mi rtag pa nyid kyis rjes su bcings par grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pas kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o // de la sdug bsngal yang ma yin / bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni /
translated: The suffering of change is to be seen as the suffering of formations due to the perversion of pleasure, because it is the basis of the suffering of change, because it is the cause of the suffering of change, because it is the support of the suffering of change, because it is the condition of the suffering of change, because it is the origin of the suffering of change, because it is the source of the suffering of change, because it is the origination of the suffering of change, because it is the proximate origination of the suffering of change, and because it is the condition that produces the suffering of change.ğŸ”½The suffering of formations is to be seen as the suffering of formations due to the perversion of the self, because it is the basis of the suffering of formations, because it is the cause of the suffering of formations, because it is the support of the suffering of formations, because it is the condition of the suffering of formations, because it is the origin of the suffering of formations, because it is the source of the suffering of formations, because it is the origination of the suffering of formations, because it is the proximate origination of the suffering of formations, and because it is the condition that produces the suffering of formations.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang // de myong bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal nyid /ğŸ”½de gnyis las rnam par ma grol bas res 'ga' ni bde ba'i gnas skabs la brten /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang // de myong bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal nyid / de gnyis las rnam par ma grol bas res 'ga' ni bde ba'i gnas skabs la brten /
translated: The suffering of formations is to be seen as the suffering of formations due to the perversion of permanence, because it is the basis of the suffering of formations, because it is the cause of the suffering of formations, because it is the support of the suffering of formations, because it is the condition of the suffering of formations, because it is the origin of the suffering of formations, because it is the source of the suffering of formations, because it is the origination of the suffering of formations, because it is the proximate origination of the suffering of formations, and because it is the condition that produces the suffering of formations.ğŸ”½The suffering of formations is to be seen as the suffering of formations due to the perversion of pleasure, because it is the basis of the suffering of formations, because it is the cause of the suffering of formations, because it is the support of the suffering of formations, because it is the condition of the suffering of formations, because it is the origin of the suffering of formations, because it is the source of the suffering of formations, because it is the origination of the suffering of formations, because it is the proximate origination of the suffering of formations, and because it is the condition that produces the suffering of formations.

original: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la brten te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la brten te /
translated: The suffering of formations is to be

original: dus rtag tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus rtag tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is a state that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de lta bas na mi rtag pas rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rtag pas rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of being bound by impermanence and because of being unpleasant,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that conditioned things are suffering.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, three elements, and part of the element of the mental object and of the mental consciousness are included in the truth of suffering.

original: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All of them, with the exception of part of the two elements of the mental and the mental object.

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dang / zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dag go //
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dang / zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: Part of the element of the mental object and of the mental element, which are pure, and the rest.

original: bdag @172a * //
analyzed: bdag @172a * //
translated: The self.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a self that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: ji ltar na rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are with result and how many are without result?

original: ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas par brtag / mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas par brtag / mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni /
translated: Unwholesome and wholesome contaminated action

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be understood as having a ripened effect.

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la yod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la yod de /
translated: The unwholesome and the wholesome contaminated action have a ripened effect in the future, because the consciousness that takes up the ripened effect of the unwholesome and the wholesome contaminated action exists in the future.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa de nas de gnyis rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa de nas de gnyis rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, these two, the unwholesome and the wholesome contaminated action, are said to have a ripened effect.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / rnam par shes pa bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / rnam par shes pa bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, ten elements, seven forms of consciousness, and the form, sound, and entity elements.

original: skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of four sense-spheres.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams dang / lung ma bstan dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams dang / lung ma bstan dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs so //
translated: The sense-spheres of form, sound, mind, and entity, excluding the indeterminate and the uncontaminated.

original: bdag la phung po 'jog par byed pa dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed par mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la phung po 'jog par byed pa dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed par mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abandon attachment to the self as that which lays down the aggregates and that which connects with a new existence.

original: rnam par smin pa ni kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The result of retribution should be understood as the appropriating consciousness together with its associated elements.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The other are born of retribution.

original: de las gzhan pa ni 'dir mig la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa des 'byung bar brjod pa thob pa de de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar na zas /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni 'dir mig la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa des 'byung bar brjod pa thob pa de de las skyes pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na zas /
translated: The other are the eye, etc., pleasure, etc., because they are said to arise from that retribution, since they are obtained from that.ğŸ”½How many are nutriment?

original: zas rnams ni du /
analyzed: zas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are not nutriment?ğŸ”½All are nutriment, because they nourish the aggregates that have been appropriated.

original: ci'i phyir zas su brtag /'ju bas kyang 'ju ba las gyur pa dang / lam gyi zas 'ju ba'i dus na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zas su brtag /'ju bas kyang 'ju ba las gyur pa dang / lam gyi zas 'ju ba'i dus na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nutriment of contact is the contact that is the third nutriment.

original: yul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa dang / reg pa'i zas te /
analyzed: yul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa dang / reg pa'i zas te /
translated: The nutriment of contact is contact that is the third nutriment.ğŸ”½The nutriment of intention is the intention that is the fourth nutriment.ğŸ”½The nutriment of consciousness is the consciousness that is the first nutriment.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i yul gyi gnas kyi reg pas lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i yul gyi gnas kyi reg pas lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the contact of the body with a pleasant object benefits the body.

original: re bas kyang re ba las gyur ba dang / yid la sems pa'i zas te /
analyzed: re bas kyang re ba las gyur ba dang / yid la sems pa'i zas te /
translated: The nutriment of mental intention is the nutriment of volition,

original: 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i re ba'i dbang gis lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½len pas kyang len pa las gyur pa nyid ni zas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i re ba'i dbang gis lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // len pas kyang len pa las gyur pa nyid ni zas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: because the body is benefited by the power of the hope connected with the desired object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
translated: The nutriment of consciousness is the nutriment of the four fundamental consciousnesses,

original: kun du len ba'i rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i dbang gis lus gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun du len ba'i rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i dbang gis lus gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the body is sustained by the power of the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de dang @172b bral na lus rul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang @172b bral na lus rul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when it is absent, the body decays.

original: phung po gsum dang / khams bcu gcig dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang / khams bcu gcig dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: Three aggregates, eleven elements, five sense spheres, and part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: bdag zas kyis gnas par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zas kyis gnas par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the belief in a self that is sustained by nutriment.

original: yang zas rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang zas rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These four nutriments are established as four in summary form.

original: yang thos ni ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang thos ni ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: The body of those who have not attained purity is supported by food.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sos so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sos so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
translated: This refers to the ordinary folk of the desire realm.

original: mtha' dag gi 'ching ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mtha' dag gi 'ching ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i gnas so //
translated: It is impure because they are bound by all the bonds.ğŸ”½The body of those who have attained purity and those who have not is supported by food.

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / slob pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / slob pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
translated: This refers to the learners and the ordinary folk of the form and formless realms.

original: 'ching ba'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impure because they still have residual bonds.

original: dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The body of those who have attained purity is supported by food.ğŸ”½This refers to the arhats.

original: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because they are liberated from all the bonds.

original: gnas pa kun du ston par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa kun du ston par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the body of those who have attained mastery is supported by food.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: This refers to the Buddhas and the bodhisattvas who have attained the great superknowledges.

original: zas kyi dbang gis gnas pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas kyi dbang gis gnas pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supported by food because they manifest their life for the sake of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar na gong ma dang bcas pa gong ma dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na gong ma dang bcas pa gong ma dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: What is having a superior? How many have a superior?

original: ci'i phyir gong ma dang bcas par brtag /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gong ma dang bcas par brtag /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is that which has a superior investigated? That which has a superior should be understood as having a superior part and as having a superior class.

original: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All except for one part of the element and the sense sphere of mental objects.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: Nirvana,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pas /
translated: because its characteristic is the suchness of purification.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest of all factors.

original: bdag rdzas ngan par mngon par zhen pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rdzas ngan par mngon par zhen pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a bad substance of self.

original: ji ltar na gong na med pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na gong na med pa /
translated: What is not having a superior?

original: gong na med pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: gong na med pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are not having a superior?

original: ci'i phyir gong na med par brtag /'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gi gong na med pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gong na med par brtag /'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gi gong na med pa'o //
translated: With what aim is that which is not having a superior investigated? That which is not having a superior should be understood as one part of the unconditioned.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the element and the sense sphere of mental objects.

original: bdag rdzas mchog tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rdzas mchog tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a substantially real self.

original: de ltar na tshul 'dis rab tu dbye ba'i tshul tshad med do //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul 'dis rab tu dbye ba'i tshul tshad med do //
translated: Thus, by this method, the method of classification is immeasurable.

original: yang mdor bsdu na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the classification of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is threefold.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½kun @173a * //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o // kun @173a * //
translated: It should be understood as being based on the three natures by means of the mode of the selflessness of persons.

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification by the imagined characteristic, the classification by the dependent characteristic, and the classification by the reality characteristic.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification by the imagined characteristic?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag ce'am /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag ce'am /
translated: In regard to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, [the imagined characteristic] is the imagined characteristic of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that is imagined by the tÄ«rthikas as a self,

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: a sentient being,

original: srog gam / skye ba po'am /
analyzed: srog gam / skye ba po'am /
translated: a life-force,

original: gso ba po'am /
analyzed: gso ba po'am /
translated: a nourisher,

original: gang zag gam /ğŸ”½shed las skyes sam /
analyzed: gang zag gam /ğŸ”½shed las skyes sam /
translated: a person,ğŸ”½or a human.

original: shed bu zhes gang kun du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: shed bu zhes gang kun du brtags pa'o //
translated: The imagined is that which is imagined to be a self, etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa la brten nas med par yang bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gang kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la brten nas med par yang bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gang kun rtog pa'o //
translated: in the aggregates, etc. which do not exist as such.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the differentiation according to the characteristic of thorough analysis?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid do //
translated: It is those same aggregates, elements and sense-fields.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa de nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa de nyid de /
translated: The relative is the same as the aggregates, etc.

original: gang du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'byung ba'o //
translated: in which the imagination of what is unreal occurs.

original: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the differentiation according to the characteristic of reality?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid la bdag med cing sems can nam /ğŸ”½srog gam / skye ba po'am /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid la bdag med cing sems can nam / srog gam / skye ba po'am /
translated: It is the same as the aggregates, elements and sense-fields, but in them there is no self, no sentient being,

original: gso ba po'am /ğŸ”½gang zag gam /
analyzed: gso ba po'am / gang zag gam /
translated: no life-principle, no one who is born or causes to be born,ğŸ”½no one who feels or causes to feel,

original: shed las skyes sam /
analyzed: shed las skyes sam /
translated: no one who knows or causes to know,ğŸ”½no one who goes or causes to go.

original: shed bu med la bdag med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: shed bu med la bdag med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: There is only the absence of self and the absence of what belongs to the self.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The perfected is

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa la bdag la sogs pa med pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa la bdag la sogs pa med pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the characteristics of entity and non-entity, the characteristics of the aggregates, etc. as devoid of self, etc. and the characteristics of the existence of selflessness, etc.

original: yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there is a fourfold division:

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pas rab tu dbye ba dang / lus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pas rab tu dbye ba dang / lus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: division according to characteristics, division according to mode, division according to body and division according to continuum.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is division according to characteristics?ğŸ”½It is the division of the aggregates, elements and spheres according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams so so rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.ğŸ”½It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du bya ste /ğŸ”½gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du bya ste / gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics.

original: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: It is the division of the elements according to their own characteristics

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid kyis rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid kyis rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang /
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense bases are substantially existent, imputedly existent, conventionally existent, ultimately existent, with form, formless,

original: bstan @173b du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: bstan @173b du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: with demonstrable form, indemonstrable form, and so on, as taught.

original: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas so //
analyzed: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas so //
translated: The classification by aspect is from the perspective of the specific.

original: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification by body?

original: sems can rnams kyi lus ji snyed pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus ji snyed pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de snyed do //
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense bases are as numerous as the bodies of sentient beings.

original: so so'i lus te phung po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i lus te phung po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The individual bodies are from the perspective of the distinct aggregates and so on.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification by continuum?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis skad cig re re 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis skad cig re re 'byung ba'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense bases arise moment by moment.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification by continuum is

original: lus gcig pa las yang phung po la sogs pa'i skad cig so so gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: lus gcig pa las yang phung po la sogs pa'i skad cig so so gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The body is the same, but the other moments of the aggregates, etc., are different.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
translated: What is the knowledge of the skill in the differentiation of characteristics?

original: bdag la mngon par shes pa yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bdag la mngon par shes pa yongs su shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the self.

original: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes //
analyzed: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes //
translated: What is the knowledge of the skill in the differentiation of modes?

original: ril bo'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ril bo'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the perception of the totality.

original: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
analyzed: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
translated: What is the knowledge of the skill in the differentiation of the body?

original: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud mi za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud mi za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the perception of the non-loss of what has been done and what has not been done.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes /
translated: What is the knowledge of the skill in the differentiation of the stream?

original: brtan pa'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: brtan pa'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the perception of stability.

original: yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de rnams nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of differentiation of the aggregates, elements and spheres:

original: phyi rol du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang /ğŸ”½kun du ston pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / kun du ston pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: 1. classification according to the external; 2. classification according to the internal; 3. classification according to the long duration of time; 4. classification according to the interruption of time; 5. classification according to the time itself; 6. classification according to the manifestation.

original: phyi rol du blta bas rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: phyi rol du blta bas rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is classification according to the external?

original: gang phal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gang phal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: It is the classification of the greater part of the realm of desire.

original: phal cher bzung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa las byung ba ma gtogs par gdon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher bzung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa las byung ba ma gtogs par gdon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greater part is mentioned in order to exclude the factors of the realm of desire which are not included in the acquisition, namely, the innate good, the unconditioned factors and the part of the formless acquired through retrogressing.

original: nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is classification according to the internal?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad do //
translated: It is all that belongs to the stage of concentrated calm.

original: rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is classification according to the long duration of time?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: It is that of the ordinary man.

original: dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is classification according to the interruption of time?

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: with the exception of the last aggregates, elements and spheres of those in training and of those beyond training.

original: de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification according to time?

original: @174a * // mi slob ba rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: @174a * // mi slob ba rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams so //
translated: It is the last aggregates, elements and spheres of those beyond training.

original: kun du ston pas rab tu dbye ba gang /ğŸ”½gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams /
analyzed: kun du ston pas rab tu dbye ba gang / gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams /
translated: What is the classification according to manifestation?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kun du ston pa'o //
translated: It is the aggregates, elements and spheres manifested by the Buddhas and by the Bodhisattvas who have attained the perfections.

original: bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is the classification according to inclusion?

original: de rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in eleven ways:

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa dang / khams kyis bsdus pa dang / rigs kyis bsdus pa dang / gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa dang / grogs kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / dus kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa dang / khams kyis bsdus pa dang / rigs kyis bsdus pa dang / gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa dang / grogs kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / dus kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa dang /
translated: inclusion according to characteristics, inclusion according to elements, inclusion according to families, inclusion according to states, inclusion according to companions, inclusion according to directions, inclusion according to time, inclusion according to part,

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa dang / gcig gis gcig bsdus pa dang / don dam pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa dang / gcig gis gcig bsdus pa dang / don dam pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: 1. by the totality, 2. by the one, 3. by the absolute.

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by own-characteristic?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid des de dag nyid bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid des de dag nyid bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the aggregates, elements and spheres are included by their own characteristics.

original: dper na gzugs kyi phung po nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa nas rgya cher chos kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi phung po nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa nas rgya cher chos kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched pa'i bar du'o //
translated: For example, the aggregate of matter is included by the aggregate of matter itself, and so on up to the element of mental objects being included by the element of mental objects itself.

original: khams kyis bsdus ba gang /
analyzed: khams kyis bsdus ba gang /
translated: What is inclusion by element?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi sa bon gang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi sa bon gang /
translated: The seeds of the aggregates, elements and spheres

original: de rnams kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: are included in the element of consciousness which appropriates them.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad kun du len pa'i rnam par shes bas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad kun du len pa'i rnam par shes bas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres are included in the consciousness which appropriates them all.

original: de la thams cad kyis bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyis bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seeds of all of them are present there.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by species?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams mtshan nyid tha dad kyang phung po'i don dang khams dang / skye mched kyi don tshad mar byas nas /ğŸ”½thams cad phan tshun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams mtshan nyid tha dad kyang phung po'i don dang khams dang / skye mched kyi don tshad mar byas nas / thams cad phan tshun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are different in their characteristics, but they are all mutually inclusive, based on the meaning of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams kyis phung bo la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra na yang /
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams kyis phung bo la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra na yang /
translated: Inclusion by type means that although the aggregates, etc., are different in their characteristics, such as form, etc., which have the meaning of the aggregates, etc.,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir thams cad bsdus so //
translated: they are all mutually inclusive because they are the same in type as their own characteristics.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang nyer spyod 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang nyer spyod 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the elements and sense bases should be understood as mutually inclusive, based on the meaning of the elements and sense bases, such as the eye, etc., which have the meaning of the experience of objects and the door of arising, respectively.

original: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by state?

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi phung po dang / khams @174b dang skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi phung po dang / khams @174b dang skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus ba'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases in the state of pleasure are included by just those.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the state of suffering and the state that is neither suffering nor pleasure are also included by just those.

original: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams rigs gcig tu zin kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams rigs gcig tu zin kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas /
translated: As for inclusion by state, even though the aggregates are of one type, they are included in the state of pleasure by determining the state of pleasure,

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid ni bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid ni bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: and the state of pleasure is included by the state of pleasure itself, but not by the state of suffering.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus so //
translated: Similarly, the state of suffering and the state that is neither suffering nor pleasure are included by just those states.

original: phung po rnams ji lta bar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams ji lta bar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The constituents and sense fields should be understood in the same way as the aggregates.

original: grogs kyis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: grogs kyis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by association?

original: gzugs kyi phung po 'khor dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phung po'i grogs rnams kyis grogs kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po 'khor dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phung po'i grogs rnams kyis grogs kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The form aggregate, together with its following, is included by the inclusion of association with the other aggregates.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la yang rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½grogs khyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phung po ni sdud pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la yang rig par bya'o // grogs khyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phung po ni sdud pa na /
translated: The other aggregates, constituents, and sense fields should be understood in the same way.ğŸ”½What is inclusion by association?

original: de la brten pa tshor ba la sogs pa grogs rnams dang lhan cig du phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: de la brten pa tshor ba la sogs pa grogs rnams dang lhan cig du phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: When the form aggregate is included, it is included together with its following, i.e., feeling, etc., by the five aggregates.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa sdud pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa sdud pa na /
translated: When feeling, etc., together with their followings, are included,

original: so sor phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: each is included by the five aggregates.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang so sor khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang so sor khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the elements and the sense-spheres with their retinue.

original: phyogs kyis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: phyogs kyis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by direction?

original: shar phyogs kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang de rnams de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang de rnams de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense-spheres in the eastern direction are included in the aggregates, elements and sense-spheres themselves.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phyogs bcu rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phyogs bcu rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the other nine directions.

original: dus kyis bsdus pa gang /ğŸ”½'das pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa gang / 'das pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: What is inclusion by time?ğŸ”½The aggregates, elements and sense-spheres of the past are included in the aggregates, elements and sense-spheres themselves.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The same applies to the aggregates, elements and sense-spheres of the future and the present.

original: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa gang /
translated: What is inclusion by part?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i @175a * //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i @175a * //
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense-spheres are included in the aggregates, elements and sense-spheres themselves.

original: chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung pas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung pas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that whatever phenomena are included by any of them are included by one part.

original: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for â€œincluded by one part,â€

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: the aggregate of morality is included by one part of the aggregate of form.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The aggregates of meditative stabilization and wisdom are included by one part of the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The realms of desire, malice, and violence are included by one part of the phenomena realm.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni /
translated: The base of infinite space and so forth

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: are included by one part of the mental and phenomena bases.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni /
translated: When this is done, whatever phenomena are included by any of the aggregates, elements, and bases are included by one part of the aggregates, elements, and bases.

original: phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are included by one part.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdu ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ma lus pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdu ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ma lus pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: That which is included by the totality is the totality of all dharmas included by the aggregates, elements and sense-fields.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are included by the totality.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is called included by the totality is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The mass of suffering is included by the five appropriative aggregates.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The desire realm is included by the eighteen elements.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched ni dri dang po'i skye mched ma gtogs pa skye mched bcu po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched ni dri dang po'i skye mched ma gtogs pa skye mched bcu po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The sense-field of beings devoid of ideation is included by ten sense-fields, excluding the sense-field of odor.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that all dharmas included by the aggregates, elements and sense-fields in other sÅ«tras are included by the totality.

original: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa gang /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa gang /
translated: Which are included in which?

original: gzugs kyi phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: The form aggregate is included in how many elements and spheres?

original: khams bcu dang skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: khams bcu dang skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang ngo //
translated: It is included in ten elements and ten spheres, and also in one part of the element and sphere of mental objects.

original: tshor ba'i phung po khams du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po khams du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: The feeling aggregate is included in how many elements and spheres?

original: khams gcig dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: khams gcig dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in one element and in one part of a sphere.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ji lta bar 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ji lta bar 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the feeling aggregate, so also the perception aggregate and the formations aggregate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po khams dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po khams dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: The consciousness aggregate is included in how many elements and spheres?

original: khams bdun dang skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: khams bdun dang skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in seven elements and in one sphere.

original: @175b mig gi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: @175b mig gi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: The eye element is included in how many aggregates, elements and spheres?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
translated: It is included in one part of the form aggregate and in one element and in one sphere.

original: mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams kyang de bzhin no //
