translated: The same applies to the element of the ear, the element of the nose, the element of the tongue, and the element of the body.

original: gzugs kyi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many sense bases and in how many elements is the element of visible form included?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in one aggregate, in one sense base and in one element.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta bar /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta bar /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many sense bases and in how many elements is the element of sound included?

original: sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the element of sound, the element of smell, the element of taste and the element of the tangible.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many sense bases and in how many elements is the element of visual consciousness included?

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis so //
translated: It is included in one aggregate, in one sense base and in one element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji lta bar /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji lta bar /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many sense bases and in how many elements is the element of auditory consciousness included?

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the element of auditory consciousness, the element of olfactory consciousness, the element of gustatory consciousness, the element of tactile consciousness and the element of mental consciousness.

original: chos kyi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: chos kyi khams phung po du dang / skye mched du dag gis bsdus /
translated: How many aggregates, sense spheres and elements are included in the element of mental objects?

original: phung po gsung dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po gsung dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: One part of the aggregate of formations and one part of the sense sphere of mental objects and of the element of mental objects.

original: mig gi skye mched phung po du dang / khams du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched phung po du dang / khams du dag gis bsdus /
translated: How many aggregates, sense spheres and elements are included in the eye sense sphere?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis so //
translated: One part of the aggregate of form and one part of the sense sphere of factors and of the element of factors.

original: mig gi skye mched ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: As is the eye sense sphere, so are the ear, nose, tongue, body and mental sense spheres, as well as the sense spheres of form, sound, odor, taste and the tangible.

original: yid kyi skye mched phung po dang / khams du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched phung po dang / khams du dag gis bsdus /
translated: How many aggregates, sense spheres and elements are included in the sense sphere of factors?

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / sems can gyi khams bdun gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / sems can gyi khams bdun gyis so //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness and seven elements of consciousness.

original: chos kyi skye mched phung po du dang // khams du dag gis bsdus /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched phung po du dang // khams du dag gis bsdus /
translated: How many aggregates, sense spheres and elements are included in the sense sphere of mental objects?

original: phung po gsum dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: They are included in three aggregates, one part of the aggregate of form, and one element.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i chos phung po bstan par dang / khams bsten pa dang / skye mched bstan pa gang dag dang / gang dag de bzhin du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i chos phung po bstan par dang / khams bsten pa dang / skye mched bstan pa gang dag dang / gang dag de bzhin du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, other phenomena that are not included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, such as those that are taught in other sÅ«tras, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are taught in the SÅ«tra on the Aggregates, Elements, and Sense Bases, and those that are not taught in the sÅ«tras, such as

original: rdzas yod pa dang / btags pas yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mngon par shes par bya ba dang / gzugs can dang /
analyzed: rdzas yod pa dang / btags pas yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mngon par shes par bya ba dang / gzugs can dang /
translated: substantial existence, nominal existence, conventional existence, ultimate existence, what is to be known, what is to be cognized, what is to be directly perceived, what has form,

original: @176a * // gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: @176a * // gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa de dag kyang /
translated: what is formless, what is demonstrable, what is not demonstrable, and so on,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par ji ltar rigs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par ji ltar rigs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: should be seen as included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, as appropriate.

original: de ltar thams cad ji ltar rigs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad ji ltar rigs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, everything is taught, as appropriate.

original: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase â€œeach is included in the otherâ€ means that

original: phung po rnams ni so sor khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni so sor khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus te /
translated: the aggregates are included in the constituents and the sense fields,

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: as is appropriate.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams kyang skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams kyis bsdus shing skye mched rnams kyang phung po dang / khams rnams kyis bsdus par rgya cher khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams kyang skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams kyis bsdus shing skye mched rnams kyang phung po dang / khams rnams kyis bsdus par rgya cher khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the constituents are included in the sense fields and the aggregates, and the sense fields are included in the aggregates and the constituents. This should be understood in detail.

original: don dam par bsdus pa dang / gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par bsdus pa dang / gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The ultimate inclusion is the suchness of the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields.

original: yang sdud pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas bsdus pa dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
analyzed: yang sdud pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas bsdus pa dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of inclusion should be understood in six ways, in accordance with what is commonly recognized in the world.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those six?

original: gzhi'i gnas kyis bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi'i gnas kyis bsdus pa ni /
translated: Inclusion by the basis is

original: dper na mi rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling gis bsdus so //
analyzed: dper na mi rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling gis bsdus so //
translated: like the people who are included in JambudvÄ«pa.

original: ri dgas rnams ni dgon pas bsdus so zhes bya ba 'jig rten na brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ri dgas rnams ni dgon pas bsdus so zhes bya ba 'jig rten na brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is said in the world that deer are gathered in the forest,

original: 'dir yang mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½'ching bas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o // 'ching bas bsdus pa ni /
translated: so too here, the eye and so on are said to gather eye consciousness and so on.

original: dper na thag pa la sogs pas shing khur ba la sogs pa bcings pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sogs pas shing khur ba la sogs pa bcings pa de bzhin du /
translated: Gathering through bondage is like a load of wood and so on bound by rope and so on.

original: lus kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bcings so //ğŸ”½don mthun pas bsdus pa ni dper na /
analyzed: lus kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bcings so // don mthun pas bsdus pa ni dper na /
translated: So too, the body binds the eye and so on.

original: dgos pa thams cad mthun pa'i mi yid gcugs pa rnams phan tshun bstan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dgos pa thams cad mthun pa'i mi yid gcugs pa rnams phan tshun bstan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Gathering through having a common aim is like people who trust each other and have a common purpose.

original: dmigs pa gcig la 'byung pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig bsdus pa'o //ğŸ”½nye bar 'dzin pas bsdus pa ni dper na /ğŸ”½jo bos bran la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la 'byung pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig bsdus pa'o // nye bar 'dzin pas bsdus pa ni dper na / jo bos bran la sogs pa la /
translated: So too, those that arise in a single focal object are gathered by association.

original: bdag gir yongs su bzung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag gir yongs su bzung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Gathering through appropriation is like a master appropriating a servant and so on.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang lus bzung ngo /
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang lus bzung ngo /
translated: So too, the appropriating consciousness appropriates the body.

original: rnam par mi 'phro bas bsdus pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'phro bas bsdus pa ni dper na /
translated: The second is like the first, but is not distracted.ğŸ”½

original: bum pas chu bzung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bum pas chu bzung ba de bzhin du /
translated: The concentration of retention is like a vase that retains water.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bzung ngo //ğŸ”½mngon par sdud pas bsdus pa ni dper na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bzung ngo // mngon par sdud pas bsdus pa ni dper na /
translated: The concentration of retention retains the mind and mental activities other than those.

original: rgya mtshos 'bab chu rnams sdud pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgya mtshos 'bab chu rnams sdud pa de bzhin du /
translated: The concentration of attraction is like the ocean that attracts the rivers.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos mig la sogs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos mig la sogs pa bsdus so //
translated: The aggregate of form attracts the eye, etc.

original: @176b 'dir ni mngon par sdud pas bsdus ba'i dbang du byas nas sdud pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @176b 'dir ni mngon par sdud pas bsdus ba'i dbang du byas nas sdud pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the eleven kinds of attraction should be understood as the attraction of retention.

original: de ltar bsdus pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig thob /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig thob /
translated: What benefit is there in being skilled in the concentrations?

original: dmigs pa mngon par bsdus pa'i phan yon thob ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon par bsdus pa'i phan yon thob ste /
translated: One obtains the benefit of the attraction of the object.

original: ji lta ji ltar dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel lo //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel lo //
translated: As the object is attracted, the roots of virtue increase.

original: sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is application?

original: de yang rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
translated: It should be seen as sixfold:

original: cha med pas sbyor ba dang / 'dres par gyur pas sbyor ba dang / phrad par sbyor ba dang / lhan cig 'byung bas sbyor ba dang / bya ba sgrub pas sbyor ba dang / mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: cha med pas sbyor ba dang / 'dres par gyur pas sbyor ba dang / phrad par sbyor ba dang / lhan cig 'byung bas sbyor ba dang / bya ba sgrub pas sbyor ba dang / mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba'o //
translated: 1. the application of the partless, 2. the application of the commingled, 3. the application of the combined, 4. the application of the simultaneous, 5. the application of the accomplishment of action, and 6. the application of the realization of the concordant.

original: cha med par sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: cha med par sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the application of the partless?

original: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the non-differentiation of all the parts in regard to the atom.

original: rdul phra rab gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni cha med cing phyogs mthun pa nyid kyis tha dad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni cha med cing phyogs mthun pa nyid kyis tha dad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The form, etc., belonging to a single atom should be understood as partless and undifferentiated by reason of homogeneity.

original: 'dres par gyur pas sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pas sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the application of the commingled?

original: rdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can thams cad 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can thams cad 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the commingling of all the parts above the atom.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du chu dang / sa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'dren pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du chu dang / sa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'dren pa lta bu'o //
translated: the atoms of water and earth, etc., are commingled in muddy water.

original: phrad par sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: phrad par sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the application of the combined?

original: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams nyid phan tshun phrad pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams nyid phan tshun phrad pa'o //
translated: The association of the limited is the mutual association of the limited.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rtsig pa la 'jim gong dang / 'jim gong gzhan phrad pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: rtsig pa la 'jim gong dang / 'jim gong gzhan phrad pa lta bu'o//
translated: the mutual association of a lump of clay with a wall, or of one lump of clay with another.

original: lhan cig 'byung bas sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bas sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is association by co-existence?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas 'khod pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas 'khod pa ste /
translated: It is the co-existence of the aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa rnams so //
translated: They are co-existent because they are born together, endure together and perish together.

original: lus gcig pu la phung po la sogs pa skad cig ma rnams so //
analyzed: lus gcig pu la phung po la sogs pa skad cig ma rnams so //
translated: In one body, the aggregates, etc. are momentary.

original: bya ba sgrub bas sbyor ba gang 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½dge slong gnyis dgos pa gang yang rung ba cig la phan tshun sbyor bas zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub bas sbyor ba gang 'di lta ste / dge slong gnyis dgos pa gang yang rung ba cig la phan tshun sbyor bas zhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: What is association by the accomplishment of action?ğŸ”½It is the association of two monks, for example, who are engaged in the same activity.

original: dgos pa gcig la zhugs pa rnams phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: dgos pa gcig la zhugs pa rnams phan tshun du'o //
translated: It is the mutual association of those who are engaged in the same activity.

original: mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is association by the same objective?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs pa gcig mthun par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs pa gcig mthun par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the association of mind and mental activities with regard to the same object.

original: mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba de yang gzhan gyi dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas sbyor ba de yang gzhan gyi dngos po yin gyi /
translated: The application of the mind to the object is not its own nature, but the nature of something else.

original: bdag gi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not the nature of the mind itself,

original: 'di ltar sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ma yin zhing /
translated: because the mind is not associated with another mind,

original: tshor ba yang tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½mthun pa @177a * //
analyzed: tshor ba yang tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o // mthun pa @177a * //
translated: and feeling is not associated with another feeling, and so on.

original: gnyis yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyis yin gyi /
translated: The mind is associated with the object in two ways:

original: mi mthun pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: it is associated with a similar object, not with a dissimilar object.

original: dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, desire and hatred are not associated, nor are virtue and evil.

original: dus 'dra ba gnyis yin gyi /
analyzed: dus 'dra ba gnyis yin gyi /
translated: The mind is associated with the object in two ways:

original: dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ni ma yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: it is associated with a similar time, not with a dissimilar time.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis dang ; 'das pa dang de ltar gnyis so //ğŸ”½mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis dang ; 'das pa dang de ltar gnyis so // mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, the present and future are associated, but the present and past are not.ğŸ”½The mind is associated with the object in two ways:

original: mi mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa gnyis ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa gnyis ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
translated: it is associated with a similar realm and stage, not with a dissimilar realm or stage.ğŸ”½For example, the desire realm and the form realm are not associated.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa gnyis dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa la sogs pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½dbye ba mthun /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa gnyis dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa la sogs pa lta bu'o // dbye ba mthun /
translated: The fourth is of two types: of the third meditation, of the fourth meditation.ğŸ”½The fifth is of one type: of the perception-sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation.

original: pa'i sbyor ba'i kun du 'gro ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa'i sbyor ba'i kun du 'gro ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sixth is of one type: of the summit of cyclic existence.ğŸ”½The seventh is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The eighth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The ninth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The tenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The eleventh is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twelfth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The thirteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The fourteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The fifteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa drug po 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'o //ğŸ”½'di dag las gnas skabs thams cad du gang yang rung ba gcig med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa drug po 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'o // 'di dag las gnas skabs thams cad du gang yang rung ba gcig med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The seventeenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The eighteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The nineteenth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twentieth is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: yang sbyor ba'i kun du 'gro ba nyon mongs pa can ni /
analyzed: yang sbyor ba'i kun du 'gro ba nyon mongs pa can ni /
translated: The twenty-first is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-second is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-third is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-fourth is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: yid dang nyon mongs pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: yid dang nyon mongs pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The twenty-fifth is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: res 'ga' sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twenty-sixth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-seventh is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-eighth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The twenty-ninth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The thirtieth is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The thirty-first is of one type: of the realm of desire.

original: sems la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs ba dang / nya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs ba dang / nya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The thirty-second is of one type: of the realm of desire.ğŸ”½The

original: gnas skabs las gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs las gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Application that is due to a condition is

original: gang bde ba'i sbyor ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang bde ba'i sbyor ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: that which is associated with the application of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the applications of pain and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba ni lus sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba ni lus sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Uninterrupted application is that which occurs in the state of body and mind.

original: rgyun chad pa'i sbyor ba ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas bar du chod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i sbyor ba ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas bar du chod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Interrupted application is that which occurs in the state interrupted by the mindless meditative attainments.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa'i sbyor ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams las gang phal cher ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa'i sbyor ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams las gang phal cher ro //
translated: Application that looks outward is that of the mind and mental factors associated with the realm of desire, for the most part.

original: nang du bltas pa'i sbyor ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas pa'i sbyor ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las kha cig gi'o //
translated: Application that looks inward is that of some of the minds and mental factors of the stage of composure.

original: 'dris pa'i sbyor ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa de dag las kyang kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i sbyor ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa de dag las kyang kha cig gi'o //
translated: The association of acquaintance is that of the ordinary man's mind and mental activities, and also of some of the learners and of the adepts.

original: de la slob pa dang mi slob ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la slob pa dang mi slob ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, the learners and adepts are

original: gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan @177b pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan @177b pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: the wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate minds and mental activities that are exclusively mundane.

original: ji ltar rigs par ro //ğŸ”½ma 'dris pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par ro // ma 'dris pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: They are so in the appropriate cases.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dang po dang / de'i 'og ma rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dang po dang / de'i 'og ma rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The association of non-acquaintance is that of the first pure mind and mental activities, and also of those that follow it, and of those that are obtained subsequent to the pure.

original: dang po dang de'i 'og ma rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po dang de'i 'og ma rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first and those that follow it are

original: sngar med pa'i skyes pa nyid kyis skad cig dang po las byung ba rnams dang / skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa las byung ba rnams kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi ma 'dris pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar med pa'i skyes pa nyid kyis skad cig dang po las byung ba rnams dang / skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa las byung ba rnams kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi ma 'dris pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are known to be unmixed with those that arise in the first moment by virtue of their arising without having existed previously, and also to be unmixed with those that arise in the second moment and so on.

original: sbyor ba la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob /
analyzed: sbyor ba la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob /
translated: What benefit is there in being skilled in the application of the term â€œmind onlyâ€?

original: sems tsam la tshor ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba ma yin pa shes so //ğŸ”½de shes na bdag tshor bar byed de //
analyzed: sems tsam la tshor ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba ma yin pa shes so // de shes na bdag tshor bar byed de //
translated: One knows the application and non-application of the dharmas of feeling and so on, of defilement and purification, in the mind only.ğŸ”½When one knows that, one knows: â€œI feel,

original: 'du shes su byed do //ğŸ”½sems par byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes su byed do // sems par byed do //
translated: I perceive,ğŸ”½I think,

original: dran par byed do //
analyzed: dran par byed do //
translated: I remember,

original: kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: I am defiled,

original: rnam par byang ngo shes mngon par zhen pa spong zhing bdag med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par byang ngo shes mngon par zhen pa spong zhing bdag med pa la 'jug go //
translated: I am purified.â€ One abandons attachment to self-existence and enters into selflessness.

original: ldan pa gang /
analyzed: ldan pa gang /
translated: What is possession?

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: It is as previously defined.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes gdags so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes gdags so zhes pa'o //
translated: The increase and decrease of wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate dharmas is designated as acquisition, attainment and possession.

original: rab tu dbye bas ni yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ni yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: By way of differentiation, it is threefold:

original: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: endowed with seeds, endowed with mastery and endowed with manifestation.

original: sa bon dang ldan pa gang /
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa gang /
translated: What is it to be endowed with seeds?

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
translated: One who has been born in the desire realm is endowed with the seeds of the defilements and secondary defilements associated with the desire realm, and of the defilements and secondary defilements associated with the form and formless realms,

original: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: and of the wholesome acquired through birth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur pa ni /
translated: One who has been born in the desire realm is endowed with the seeds of the defilements and secondary defilements associated with the desire realm,ğŸ”½and of the wholesome acquired through birth.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is associated with the defilements and secondary defilements of the three realms.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as referring to the ordinary man who is not detached.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'am gong mar skyes kyang rung ste /ğŸ”½sa gang gi 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams dang / sa de dang mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa yang yin te /ğŸ”½gnyen pos gnod pa byas pa dang / bag la nyal legs par ma bcom pa'i @178a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'am gong mar skyes kyang rung ste / sa gang gi 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams dang / sa de dang mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa yang yin te / gnyen pos gnod pa byas pa dang / bag la nyal legs par ma bcom pa'i @178a * //
translated: The detached person, whether he is born in a lower stage or in a higher stage,ğŸ”½is not associated with the defilements and secondary defilements of the stage in which he is detached, but he is associated with those of the stages below.

original: phyir go rims bzhin no //ğŸ”½skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir go rims bzhin no // skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the counteractives have not destroyed the latent tendencies.ğŸ”½The wholesome by birth is associated with the stage in which one is born.

original: gang du skyes pa'i sa pa nyid dang / ldan no //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa'i sa pa nyid dang / ldan no //
translated: The wholesome acquired through preparatory effort is associated with the stage in which one practices it.ğŸ”½The wholesome of the realm of desire is associated with the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes bar gyur pa ni /
translated: The wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality is associated with the realm of fine-materiality.ğŸ”½The wholesome of the realm of immateriality is associated with the realm of immateriality.

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis don dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis don dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The afflictions and secondary afflictions associated with the realm of desire are said to be associated with the object, and not associated with the object.

original: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: The afflictions and secondary afflictions associated with the realm of form, and the wholesome by birth in the realm of form, are associated with the object, because they are associated with the seeds.

original: gzugs med par skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Those who are born in the formless realm are said to be associated with the seeds of the afflictions and secondary afflictions associated with the realms of desire and form, and not associated with the object.

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams ni sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams ni sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: The afflictions and secondary afflictions associated with the formless realm, and the wholesome by birth in the formless realm, are associated with the object, because they are associated with the seeds.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa ni /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa ni /
translated: The acquisition of the counteragent to the three realms

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba de dang de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas ldan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba de dang de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas ldan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not non-possession of the seeds of that which has arisen as the counteragent to any given mode.

original: gang gi gnyen po ma byung ba de'i sa bon dang ldan pas rab tu ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi gnyen po ma byung ba de'i sa bon dang ldan pas rab tu ldan pa'o //
translated: It is possession of the seeds of that which has not arisen as the counteragent.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The acquisition of the counteragent to the three realms refers to

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'o //

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen por 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen por 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which has arisen as the counteragent to any given mode refers to

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: the great, etc., defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½One is not possessed of the seeds of that which has arisen as the counteragent, but one is possessed of the seeds of that which has not arisen as the counteragent.

original: den de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas kyang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal legs bar bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: den de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas kyang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal legs bar bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the latent impressions have been well destroyed.

original: dbang ldan gang /
analyzed: dbang ldan gang /
translated: What is the one who has power?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa de dag las kyang kha cig ni dbang dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa de dag las kyang kha cig ni dbang dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: The wholesome dharmas that are born of preparation, the mundane and supramundane concentrations, liberations, samÄdhis, samÄpattis, etc., and the indeterminate dharmas, some of which are possessed by the power of possession.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa rnams zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i sa bon yod du zin kyang /

analyzed: de goms par ma byas pa skye ba de'i sa bon thob ma thag gis mngon sum du byed mi nus ba'i phyir ro //
translated: cannot be manifested immediately upon birth because they have not been cultivated.

analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa de dag las kyang kha cig ces bya ba ni bzo'i gnas dang / sprul ba'i sems la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some of the indeterminate dharmas are the mind of skill in arts and crafts, the mind of emanation, etc.

original: kun 'byung ba dang ldan pa gang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang ldan pa gang /
translated: What is the possession of the origin?

original: phung po dang / khams @178b dang ; skye mched rnams las dge ba'am /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams @178b dang ; skye mched rnams las dge ba'am /
translated: The aggregates, elements and sense bases are virtuous,ğŸ”½

original: mi dge ba'am /ğŸ”½lung du bstan ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am / lung du bstan ba'am /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rung chos gang dang gang mngon du gyur pa de nyid kun 'byung pa dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rung chos gang dang gang mngon du gyur pa de nyid kun 'byung pa dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: Whatever wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomena manifest, one is endowed with them because one possesses the origin of those phenomena.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa dang // ldan pa ma yin zhes kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa dang // ldan pa ma yin zhes kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that those whose wholesome roots have been severed are endowed with the seeds of wholesome phenomena, but are not endowed with the causes of liberation.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang gtan du ldan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' pa'i chos can gyi 'dod chen pa rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya ste /ğŸ”½de dag la thar pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir gtan du ste /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang gtan du ldan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' pa'i chos can gyi 'dod chen pa rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya ste / de dag la thar pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir gtan du ste /
translated: Moreover, those who are permanently afflicted should be seen as those who are destined to never attain nirvana, such as those with extreme views.

original: rgyu dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: For them, there is no cause for liberation, so they are permanently without causes.

original: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /

original: de bzhin nyid la nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gnas pa yin te /
translated: The reality of the afflictions is the reality of the negative reflex actions.ğŸ”½The reality of the antidote is the reality of the positive reflex actions.

original: rgyud gang la gnyen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen rnyed na legs par 'joms nus pa /ğŸ”½de skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gang la gnyen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen rnyed na legs par 'joms nus pa / de skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: ldog pa ni rgyu dang mi ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rgyu dang mi ldan par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: ldan pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob /

original: chos rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa shes par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de ltar 'phel ba dang 'grib pa shes na 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'am /

analyzed: ji snyed pa de dag la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spang bar 'gyur ro // mngon pa chos kun las btus pa las mtshan nyid kun nas btus pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One abandons attachment and aversion to all that exists.ğŸ”½This concludes the Compendium of Characteristics, the first compendium

original: // / rnam nges gang /

analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten dag gi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyur bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œarising through the power of karma and mental afflictionsâ€ indicates the causes of the suffering of sentient beings and the suffering of the physical world, respectively.

original: gang yang yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste /ğŸ”½de dag las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang yang yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste / de dag las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa ma yin /
translated: The phrase â€œthe pure world spheresâ€ should be understood as referring to those world spheres that are not included within the truth of suffering.ğŸ”½They are not created by karma and mental afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not arise through the power of karma and mental afflictions.

original: gang yang smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis byung ba dag go //
analyzed: gang yang smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis byung ba dag go //
translated: They are created by the power of prayers and roots of virtue.

original: de lta bas na sngas rgyas rnams kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sngas rgyas rnams kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are the objects of the buddhas,

original: skye ba'i gnas de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: those places of rebirth are inconceivable.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul yang ma yin na /
translated: They are not even the objects of the meditative absorptions of those who are absorbed in meditation,

original: rtog ge ba rnams kyi yul yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rtog ge ba rnams kyi yul yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone the objects of those who are involved in speculation.

original: sngar mtha' dag sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: sngar mtha' dag sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Previously, the entire truth of suffering was taught as a characteristic.

original: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las brtsams te /ğŸ”½mdo @180a * //
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las brtsams te / mdo @180a * //
translated: Now, beginning with the truth of suffering,

original: las gsungs pa bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: las gsungs pa bstan pa'i don du /
translated: the meaning of what is taught in the sutrağŸ”½is presented in the analysis.

original: rnam par dbye ba brtsams te gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba brtsams te gsungs pa /
translated: The analysis is presented as follows:

original: yang skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi dga' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dga' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: yang skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi dga' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dga' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The suffering of birth, the suffering of aging, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires,

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: in brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba'i sdug bsngal /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba'i sdug bsngal /
translated: Why is birth suffering?

original: dog pa'i sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dog pa'i sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the suffering of confinement and other sufferings.

original: ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa las byung ba dang / mngal na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir te /
analyzed: ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa las byung ba dang / mngal na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir te /
translated: The suffering of birth is twofold: the suffering of being squeezed in the womb and the suffering of being squeezed in the birth canal.ğŸ”½The suffering of being squeezed in the womb is due to the fact that the fetus is squeezed between the motherâ€™s stomach and her spine.

original: lus kyi yan lag kun du btsir ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½btsas nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhar la 'byung ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag kun du btsir ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro // btsas nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhar la 'byung ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The suffering of being squeezed in the birth canal is due to the fact that the fetus is squeezed by various impure substances in the womb and is squeezed by all the limbs of its body.

original: ci'i phyir rga ba'i sdug bsngal na tshod 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rga ba'i sdug bsngal na tshod 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of aging is due to the fact that the body ages.

original: ci'i phyir na ba'i sdug bsngal khams 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½ci'i phyir 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na ba'i sdug bsngal khams 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro // ci'i phyir 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal /
translated: The suffering of sickness is due to the fact that the elements of the body are disturbed.

original: srog 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½ci'i phyir mi dga' pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal /ğŸ”½phrad pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog 'gyur ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro // ci'i phyir mi dga' pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal / phrad pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of death is due to the fact that life is disturbed.ğŸ”½The suffering of encountering what is unpleasant is due to the fact that encountering what is unpleasant is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir dga' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dga' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal /
translated: The suffering of separation from what is pleasant is due to the fact that separation from what is pleasant is suffering.ğŸ”½The suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is due to the fact that not obtaining what one longs for is suffering.

original: bral ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because separation is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal /
translated: Why is the non-acquisition of what one wants suffering?

original: re ba 'bras bu med pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: re ba 'bras bu med pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-fulfillment of one's hopes is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal gnas ngan len sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal gnas ngan len sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Why is it, in brief, that the five appropriative aggregates are suffering? Because they are the suffering of the impure influences.

original: de dag brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur /
translated: Although there are eight, they are reduced to six.

original: drug yin yang brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: drug yin yang brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Although there are six, they are increased to eight.

original: dog pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: dog pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The eight are: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, the suffering of the undesirable, the suffering of separation, the suffering of the non-fulfillment of one's hopes, and the suffering of the impure influences.

original: de rnams phan tshun brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams phan tshun brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: These are mutually reduced to eight,

original: gsum gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are made into three kinds of suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal nyid gsum gsungs na ci sdug bsngal nyid gsum bo dag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad bsdus sam /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal nyid gsum gsungs na ci sdug bsngal nyid gsum bo dag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad bsdus sam /
translated: If the three kinds of suffering are taught, are the eight kinds of suffering included in the three kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyis sdug bsngal nyid gsum bsdus she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyis sdug bsngal nyid gsum bsdus she na /
translated: Or are the three kinds of suffering included in the eight kinds of suffering?

original: gcig gis @180b gcig bsdus te /
analyzed: gcig gis @180b gcig bsdus te /
translated: One is included in the other.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gang gsungs pa 'dis ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gang gsungs pa 'dis ni /
translated: The suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, and the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant,

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: teach the suffering of suffering.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug /
translated: The suffering of birth and so on teach the suffering of change.

original: bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence teaches the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the intrinsic identity of the phenomena that are the experience of suffering is the suffering of suffering.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te mi rnyed pa yang sdug bsngal zhes gsungs pa 'dis ni /
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te mi rnyed pa yang sdug bsngal zhes gsungs pa 'dis ni /
translated: The suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for are taught to be suffering.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to ;
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to ;
translated: This teaches the suffering of change.

original: / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The suffering of change is taught by the suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and so on.

original: phrad pa dang ma phrad pas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa dang ma phrad pas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the experience of pleasure through contact or the absence of contact is the characteristic of change.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa 'di ni /
translated: In brief, the statement â€œThe five appropriated aggregates are sufferingâ€

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: teaches the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates

original: sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: are taught to be suffering.

original: gnyis las rnam par ma grol zhing mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'brel te /
analyzed: gnyis las rnam par ma grol zhing mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'brel te /
translated: They are not free from the two and are associated with impermanence.

original: grub pa dang bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not established and are not pleasure.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The conventional truth is suffering. The ultimate truth is suffering.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba ni gang /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba ni gang /
translated: What is the conventional truth of suffering?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa sdug bsngal ba ni gang /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa sdug bsngal ba ni gang /
translated: What is the ultimate truth of suffering?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas /
translated: The suffering of birth,

original: 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar ni /
translated: up to the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: this is the conventional truth of suffering.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of mundane knowledge.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsung pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsung pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: In brief, the statement â€œThe five appropriated aggregates are sufferingâ€ is the ultimate truth of suffering.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of supramundane wisdom through the door of the suchness of abiding.

original: sdug bsngal spyi'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal spyi'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the general characteristic of suffering?

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of impermanence, the characteristic of suffering, the characteristic of emptiness, and the characteristic of selflessness.

original: sdug bsngal spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The general characteristic of suffering is

original: rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de dag mi rtag pa la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de dag mi rtag pa la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa ste /
translated: the yogiâ€™s analysis of the truth of suffering in terms of impermanence, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: @181a * // mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: @181a * // mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: by way of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of impermanence?

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of impermanence is

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: to be known as having twelve aspects.

original: de yang / med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / skad cig gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de yang / med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / skad cig gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Furthermore, they are: the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of complete destruction, the characteristic of change, the characteristic of separation, the characteristic of proximity, the characteristic of phenomena, the characteristic of moments, the characteristic of continuity,

original: nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snod 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snod 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of disease, etc., the characteristic of the various transformations of the mind, the characteristic of the decline of abundant enjoyment, and the characteristic of the destruction and evolution of the receptacle world.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag dang bdag gi dus rtag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag dang bdag gi dus rtag tu med pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-existence is the permanent non-existence of a self and of things pertaining to a self in the aggregates, elements and sense-fields.

original: de yang med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de yang med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of non-existence is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the truth of suffering as impermanence is the non-existence of the self and of what belongs to the self by own nature.

original: mi rtag pa ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of impermanence is negation.

original: rtag ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word â€œpermanentâ€ has the meaning of all times.

original: rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of grasping?

original: gang 'du byed skyes pa rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed skyes pa rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is the destruction of the formations that have arisen.

original: byung nas med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byung nas med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the non-existence after having existed.

original: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of change?

original: gang 'du byed rnams gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed rnams gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the formations from one condition to another.

original: rgyud mi 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud mi 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the stream.

original: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid gang 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa nyams pa dang / gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid gang 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa nyams pa dang / gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: What is the characteristic of relation? It is the loss of control over the formations and their appropriation by others.

original: dngos po'i gnas skabs de nyid la rang bzhin gyi dbang nyams pa dang / kha cig tu gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas skabs de nyid la rang bzhin gyi dbang nyams pa dang / kha cig tu gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the state of the thing itself is the loss of the power of nature, and that in some cases it is taken over by another.

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the proximate characteristic?

original: mi rtag ba'i mtshan nyid kyis non pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ba'i mtshan nyid kyis non pa'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of impermanence.

original: de nyid kyi che na mi rtag pa nyid myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi che na mi rtag pa nyid myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of impermanence itself.

original: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of reality?

original: mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba rgyus 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba rgyus 'brel ba'o //
translated: It is the connection with the cause of the arising of impermanence.

original: gang gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that which one must experience.

original: skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of momentariness?

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that conditioned things do not remain for a second moment after the first.

original: bdag nyid 'byung nas de ma thag tu gdon mi za bar rnam par 'jig pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'byung nas de ma thag tu gdon mi za bar rnam par 'jig pa nyid do //
translated: It is the fact that, having arisen, they perish immediately.

original: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of continuity?

original: thog ma med @181b pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams kyi skye mched rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med @181b pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams kyi skye mched rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is the uninterrupted arising of conditioned things since beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba 'ong ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'byung zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba 'ong ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'byung zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of arising is that there is coming and going in beginningless cyclic existence.

original: nang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What are the characteristics of the internal and so on?

original: khams dang / na tshod dang / srog rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khams dang / na tshod dang / srog rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the elements, the stages of life, and the life force.

original: na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of sickness, aging, and death are

original: khams ma snyoms pa dang / spyi cer la sogs pa dang / gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa spyad pa'o //
analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa dang / spyi cer la sogs pa dang / gnas pa'i dus kyis 'phen pa spyad pa'o //
translated: imbalances of the elements, wrinkles and so on, and the exhaustion of the life force projected by previous karma.

original: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of the various modifications of mind?

original: res 'ga' 'dod chags dang / bcas pa'i sems dang / res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'dod chags dang / bcas pa'i sems dang / res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
translated: It is the mind sometimes being associated with attachment and sometimes being free from attachment, and similarly, sometimes being associated with aversion and sometimes being free from aversion, and sometimes being associated with delusion and sometimes being free from delusion.

original: bsdus pa dang g-yeng ba dang / bying ba dang rab tu bzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsdus pa dang g-yeng ba dang / bying ba dang rab tu bzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the state of being in meditative concentration and not being in meditative concentration, and so on.

original: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the various modifications of mind is

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i gnas skabs la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i gnas skabs la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: the state of being the basis of the adverse states and their antidotes.

original: longs spyod 'byor ba rgud pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: longs spyod 'byor ba rgud pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of the decline of wealth?

original: 'byor ba thams cad kyi mtha' rgud pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byor ba thams cad kyi mtha' rgud pa nyid do //
translated: The end of all prosperity is decline.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa thams cad gtan du 'dug pa ma yin pas mthar nyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa thams cad gtan du 'dug pa ma yin pas mthar nyes pa nyid do //
translated: Because all worldly prosperity does not last, it is a fault in the end.

original: snod 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: snod 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of the destruction and evolution of the receptacle world?

original: 'jig par byed pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of destruction:

original: me dang chu dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: me dang chu dang rlung ngo //
translated: by fire, water, and wind.

original: 'jig pa na 'dus pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa na 'dus pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of destruction:

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
translated: the second meditation, the third meditation, the fourth meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa ni ;
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa ni ;
translated: The fourth meditation is the stage of the receptacle world.

original: gzhal med khang rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / lhan cig 'gags pas 'jig cing 'chags so //
analyzed: gzhal med khang rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / lhan cig 'gags pas 'jig cing 'chags so //
translated: The receptacle world is created and destroyed with the creation and destruction of the palaces.

original: sa chen po la sogs pa me la sogs pas yang dang yang du 'jig pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa chen po la sogs pa me la sogs pas yang dang yang du 'jig pa 'byung ste /
translated: The great earth is destroyed by fire, water and wind.ğŸ”½The world is destroyed by fire, water and wind, respectively, at the end of the first, second and third meditations.ğŸ”½The world is destroyed by fire up to the world of the second meditation;

original: me dang / chu dang / rlung gis 'tshig par byed pa dang / 'drul bar byed pa dang / skam par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa rnams dang / go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i mthar thug par 'jig rten gnas pa 'jig go //
analyzed: me dang / chu dang / rlung gis 'tshig par byed pa dang / 'drul bar byed pa dang / skam par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa rnams dang / go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i mthar thug par 'jig rten gnas pa 'jig go //
translated: it is destroyed by water up to the world of the third meditation;ğŸ”½it is destroyed by wind up to the world of the fourth meditation.ğŸ”½The rest of the world, which remains, is the other abodes of the second, third and fourth meditations.

original: de'i gong ma lhag ma lus pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gang yin pa de dag ni @182a * //ğŸ”½lus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gong ma lhag ma lus pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gang yin pa de dag ni @182a * //ğŸ”½lus par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the worlds that remain.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams gang gis 'jig cing 'chags zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams gang gis 'jig cing 'chags zhe na /
translated: By what is the celestial mansion of the fourth absorption destroyed and formed?

original: phyi rol gang gis kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gang gis kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not destroyed and formed by anything external.

original: gzhal med khang de dag ni /
analyzed: gzhal med khang de dag ni /
translated: These celestial mansions

original: sems can de dag nyid skye ba dang / lhan cig tu grub cing /
analyzed: sems can de dag nyid skye ba dang / lhan cig tu grub cing /
translated: are formed together with the birth of those sentient beings

original: 'ching ba dang lhan cig tu 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba dang lhan cig tu 'gag ste /
translated: and are destroyed together with their death.

original: de nyid de dag gis 'chags pa dang / 'jig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de dag gis 'chags pa dang / 'jig par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are formed and destroyed by them.

original: bskal ba bar ma gsum ste /
analyzed: bskal ba bar ma gsum ste /
translated: There are three intermediate eons:

original: mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma dang / nad kyi bskal ba bar ma dang / mtshon gyi bskal ba bar ma ste /
analyzed: mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma dang / nad kyi bskal ba bar ma dang / mtshon gyi bskal ba bar ma ste /
translated: the intermediate eon of famine, the intermediate eon of disease, and the intermediate eon of swords.

original: de dag gis bskal ba tshar phyir par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bskal ba tshar phyir par 'gyur ro //
translated: These complete one cycle of eons.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œcompleteâ€ is â€œto be finished.â€

original: mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal ba gcig dang / yar 'phral dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad dang / yar skye ba gcig ste /
analyzed: mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal ba gcig dang / yar 'phral dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad dang / yar skye ba gcig ste /
translated: One intermediate eon of decrease, eighteen intermediate eons of decrease, and one intermediate eon of increase.

original: de la mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad ces pa ni /
analyzed: de la mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad ces pa ni /
translated: One intermediate kalpa of the world's creation,ğŸ”½one intermediate kalpa of the world's destruction,ğŸ”½eighteen intermediate kalpas of creation and of duration,

original: chags pa'i dus na mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad ni de dang bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i dus na mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang / mar 'bri ba bco brgyad ni de dang bcu dgu'o //
translated: make nineteen intermediate kalpas.

original: de'i 'og tu tha mar yar skye ba gcig go //ğŸ”½bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'jig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tha mar yar skye ba gcig go // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'jig go //
