translated: Then follows one intermediate kalpa of creation.ğŸ”½The world stays created for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten zhig par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½bar gyi bskal ba ni shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten zhig par 'gyur ro // bar gyi bskal ba ni shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
translated: The world is in the process of creation for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten chags nas 'dug go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten chags nas 'dug go //
translated: The world stays created for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa chen po brgyad cu ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa chen po brgyad cu ste /
translated: These twenty make eighty intermediate kalpas.

original: de ni bskal pa chen po'o //ğŸ”½bskal ba bgrang ba'i tshul des /
analyzed: de ni bskal pa chen po'o // bskal ba bgrang ba'i tshul des /
translated: This is a great kalpa.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad do //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad do //
translated: The calculation of the life expectancy of the gods of the realm of desire is established according to the same principle.ğŸ”½The gods of the realm of fine-materiality and the gods of the realm of immateriality live, respectively, one great kalpa and so on.

original: sems can de dag gi tshe zad cing bsod nams zad pa las kyang zad nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi tshe zad cing bsod nams zad pa las kyang zad nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro /
translated: When the life, merit, and karma of those sentient beings are exhausted, they die and transmigrate from that place.

original: tshe zad pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: tshe zad pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it by the exhaustion of life?

original: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
translated: It is death when the time of death arrives.

original: tshe zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: tshe zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
translated: The exhaustion of life is death.

original: tshe'i 'phen pa ji tsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dus su 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i 'phen pa ji tsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dus su 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is death at the proper time, because the projection of life is complete.

original: bsod nams zad pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: bsod nams zad pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it by the exhaustion of merit?

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'o //
translated: It is untimely death.

original: 'di ltar sems can de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas bsod nams zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas bsod nams zad par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the merit of those sentient beings is exhausted by the experience of meditative attainment.

original: des na dus la ma bab kyang 'chi'o //
analyzed: des na dus la ma bab kyang 'chi'o //
translated: Therefore, they die even when the time has not come.

original: bsod nams zad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams zad ces bya ba ni /
translated: The exhaustion of merit is

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa de /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa de /
translated: untimely death.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pas /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pas /
translated: Because of the experience of meditative attainment,

original: de'i tshe @182b 'phen par byed pa'i las dgos pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe @182b 'phen par byed pa'i las dgos pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the karma that projects that life is harmed with respect to its purpose.

original: las zad pas ji lha bu /
analyzed: las zad pas ji lha bu /
translated: How is it by the exhaustion of karma?

original: der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / len grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / len grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su gtugs pa'o //
translated: karma to be experienced after rebirth, and karma to be experienced in a third life.

original: las zad nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las zad nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the karma is exhausted,

original: rgyun chad nas 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /ğŸ”½gnas der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las spyad zin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rgyun chad nas 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste / gnas der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las spyad zin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: one dies through the interruption of the life-stream.

original: med pa'i phyir der yang mi skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir der yang mi skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one is not reborn there because one has already experienced the karma to be experienced after rebirth and in a third life, or because it does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
translated: The three kinds of suffering and the eight kinds of suffering are called suffering.

original: dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½ci'i phyir gang mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa'o // ci'i phyir gang mi rtag pa ste /
translated: The suffering of change, etc.

original: sdug bsngal zhes gsungs /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes gsungs /
translated: Why is that which is impermanent called suffering?ğŸ”½Because it is the basis of suffering.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnas nyid kyi char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnas nyid kyi char gtogs pa ste /
translated: Impermanence is included in the category of the basis.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the category of birth and the category of destruction.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of the impermanence that is included in arising, one understands the suffering that is suffering.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni /
translated: The impermanence that is included in arising

original: ma byung ba las byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba nyid do //
translated: is the arising of what did not exist before.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phyogs 'du byed rnams kyi gnod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phyogs 'du byed rnams kyi gnod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the harmfulness of the formations that are included in the suffering category.

original: mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of this impermanence, one understands the suffering that is suffering.

original: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid la bsten nas /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid la bsten nas /
translated: On the basis of the impermanence that is included in cessation,

original: 'gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: one understands the suffering that is change.

original: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa ni byung nas med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa ni byung nas med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The impermanence that is included in cessation is the nonexistence of what came into being.

original: de ni bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: This is the undesirability of the formations that are included in the happiness category.

original: de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of this impermanence, one understands the suffering that is change.

original: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of the impermanence that is included in both,ğŸ”½one understands the suffering that is a universal characteristic.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun du 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun du 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not desire the arising of conditioned existence that is associated with the impurities, nor does he desire its cessation.

original: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½de la dgongs te bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas /ğŸ”½gang ci tshor yang rung /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so // de la dgongs te bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas / gang ci tshor yang rung /
translated: He understands the suffering of conditioned existence in dependence upon impermanence, which is included in both of them.

original: 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to //ğŸ”½ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid la dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to // ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid la dgongs nas /
translated: With that in mind, the Lord said, â€œI have taught that whatever is felt is suffering.

original: gang ci tshor yang @183a * //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang @183a * //
translated: I have taught that whatever is felt is suffering, intending the impermanence of conditioned phenomena and the change that is the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: rung ba 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rung ba 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: I have taught that whatever is felt is suffering, intending the impermanence of conditioned phenomena and the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshig tu dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshig tu dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: And the experience of pleasure is intended to be suffering.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni /
translated: The experience of pain is suffering

original: sdug bsngal nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is recognized as suffering in the world.

original: de yang dgongs pa brjod pa mi dgos so //
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa brjod pa mi dgos so //
translated: So there is no need to explain the intended meaning of that.

original: yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad mngon te /
analyzed: yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad mngon te /
translated: The eight sufferings of birth, etc. are manifest in the formations that are associated with the reality of birth and cessation.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½'du byed mi rtag pa gang dag la skye ba la sogs pa snang ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o // 'du byed mi rtag pa gang dag la skye ba la sogs pa snang ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: Therefore, they are called suffering.

original: sdug bsngal du dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those formations that are impermanent and in which birth, etc. are manifest are intended to be suffering because of their impermanence.

original: gzhan du na ni lam yang mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni lam yang mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the path would be suffering because of its impermanence.

original: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang gang la gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang gang la gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is that whatever is absent in whatever thing that is seen as empty of that.

original: yang 'di ltar lhag ma gang de ni 'di yod pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar lhag ma gang de ni 'di yod pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: And whatever remains in that thing as existent is correctly seen as existent there.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug pa yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug pa yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
translated: This is the correct entry into emptiness,

original: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bshad do //
translated: which is explained as being non-erroneous.

original: gang na ci zhig med /
analyzed: gang na ci zhig med /
translated: What is absent in what?

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brten pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / bdag dang bdag gi med do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brten pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / bdag dang bdag gi med do //
translated: In the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, permanence, stability, eternalism, immutability, a self, and anything belonging to a self are absent.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni des stong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni des stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, they are empty of those.

original: lhag ma gang bdag med pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhag ma gang bdag med pa nyid de /
translated: Whatever remains there is selflessness.

original: de ltar bdag ni med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bdag ni med kyi /
translated: Thus, a self does not exist,

original: bdag med pa ni yod par stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni yod par stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: but selflessness exists. This should be understood as emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'du byed rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'du byed rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: The self that has the characteristics of permanence, etc. is not different from the formations.

original: de dag la med do //
analyzed: de dag la med do //
translated: It does not exist in them.

original: 'du byed de dag ni rtag tu de dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag ni rtag tu de dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Those formations are always of the nature of the selflessness of the self, which is the nature of emptiness.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Both of these are called emptiness.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa yang yod pa dang / med pa yang med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa yang yod pa dang / med pa yang med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so ;
translated: With this in mind, the Lord said, â€œOne who sees dependent origination sees the Dharma; one who sees the Dharma sees the truth; one who sees the truth is freed from all bondage.â€

original: / yang stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / yang stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, emptiness is threefold:

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong ba nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of own-nature, the emptiness of what is not, and the emptiness of own-nature and what is not.

original: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first should be understood as referring to the imagined nature.

original: ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: Own-nature refers to the imagined nature.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid @183b kho nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid @183b kho nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist by way of their own characteristics.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second is to be understood as referring to the dependent nature.

original: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Similarly, the emptiness of what does not exist

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: is to be understood as referring to the emptiness of the dependent nature.

original: de ni rnam pa gang dang gang du kun du brtag par bya ba rnam pa de dag ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gang dang gang du kun du brtag par bya ba rnam pa de dag ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspects in which it is imagined to exist do not exist.

original: gsum pa ni yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third is to be understood as referring to the perfected nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is to be understood as referring to the perfected nature.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: Because it is the nature of emptiness.ğŸ”½What is the definition of selflessness?

original: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid nges /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid nges /
translated: What is the definition of self as imagined by the proponents of self?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are selfless by their very nature.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed de dag nyid bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed de dag nyid bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of selflessness is that those very formations are not the nature imagined by those who speak of a self.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With this in mind, the Blessed One said, â€œAll phenomena are selfless.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag thams cad ni nga yi ba med pa'o //ğŸ”½'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag thams cad ni nga yi ba med pa'o // 'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, â€œAll of this is not mine.ğŸ”½This is not my self.

original: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa ste /
translated: This is not my essence.

original: de ni 'di bzhin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ci /
analyzed: de ni 'di bzhin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ci /
translated: One should see this as it is with right wisdom.â€ What is the meaning of this?

original: ci'i phyir dngos po 'di ni bdag gi ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po 'di ni bdag gi ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Why is this thing not mine?

original: nang gi dngos po 'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po 'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
translated: This inner thing is not me.

original: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the statement This is not my self is as follows:

original: 'di ltar phyi'i dngos po la ni bdag gi rnam pa dang / nang la ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i dngos po la ni bdag gi rnam pa dang / nang la ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa bkag pa'o //
translated: The idea of mine is eliminated with respect to external things, and the ideas of self and mine are eliminated with respect to internal things.

original: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu /
translated: How is it that impermanence is said to be the characteristic of momentariness?

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma yin pa /
translated: Because mind and mental factors are momentary.

original: de ltar gzugs kyang skad cig mar blta bar bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyang skad cig mar blta bar bya ste //
translated: Thus, form should be viewed as momentary,

original: sems kyis zin pa dang / sems dang / grub pa bde ba gcig pa dang / sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba dang / sems kyi gnas yin pa dang / sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / sems kyi dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis zin pa dang / sems dang / grub pa bde ba gcig pa dang / sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba dang / sems kyi gnas yin pa dang / sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / sems kyi dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is grasped by the mind, it is associated with the mind, it is of the same substance as the mind, it changes when the mind changes, it is the basis of the mind, it arises by the power of the mind, and it is controlled by the mind.

original: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, because it is perceived to change in the end, and because it perishes by itself without depending on conditions after it has arisen.

original: gzugs kyang skad cig ma nyid du blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½'du byed thams @184a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyang skad cig ma nyid du blta bar bya'o // 'du byed thams @184a * //
translated: Form should be seen as momentary.

original: cad 'jig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ni grags la /
analyzed: cad 'jig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ni grags la /
translated: All formations are impermanent in the sense of being subject to destruction, etc.,

original: skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid du ni ma grags te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid du ni ma grags te /
translated: but they are not well known as being momentary.

original: de'i phyir de 'grub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'grub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that should be established.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig rten na grags te /
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig rten na grags te /
translated: In this regard, mind and mental factors are well known in the world as being momentary.

original: de'i phyir de ma grub pa gzugs kyi skad cig pa nyid du bsgrub bo //ğŸ”½ji ltar zhe na sems kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma grub pa gzugs kyi skad cig pa nyid du bsgrub bo // ji ltar zhe na sems kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, their nonestablishment is established as the momentariness of form.

original: sems skad cig mas lus zin pa'o //
analyzed: sems skad cig mas lus zin pa'o //
translated: How so? â€œBecause it is held by mindâ€ means the body is held by momentary mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established and happy in the same way.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi lus ni yang dag par grub kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi lus ni yang dag par grub kyi /
translated: Thus, a body that possesses consciousness is well established,

original: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i lus ni rul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i lus ni rul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but a body that is devoid of consciousness is rotten.

original: de lta bas na sems dang grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems dang grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the mind and the body are the same in being a real entity and in being happiness,

original: de bzhin du 'di yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the body is momentary in the same way that the mind is.

original: sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the body changes when the mind changes.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems 'gyur bas lus 'gyur bar snang ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems 'gyur bas lus 'gyur bar snang ste /
translated: In the states of happiness, suffering, desire, hatred, and so on, the mind changes and the body is seen to change.

original: de'i phyir skad cig re re la 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig re re la 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the body changes in accordance with the changing mind at every moment, it is established that the body is momentary.

original: sems kyi gnas yin pa dang zhes bya ba las dbang po nyid dang bcas pa'i lus ni sems kyi gnas su grub pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas yin pa dang zhes bya ba las dbang po nyid dang bcas pa'i lus ni sems kyi gnas su grub pa ste /
translated: Because the body is the basis of the mind. The body together with the sense faculties is established as the basis of the mind.

original: gang zhig gi skye ba'i gnas yin pa de /
analyzed: gang zhig gi skye ba'i gnas yin pa de /
translated: That which is the basis of the arising of something

original: bdag 'jig pa med par de'i gnas su 'gyur ba mi snang ste /
analyzed: bdag 'jig pa med par de'i gnas su 'gyur ba mi snang ste /
translated: is not seen to be its basis when it is destroyed.

original: dper na ma dang myu gu la sogs pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma dang myu gu la sogs pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a seed is the basis of the arising of a sprout, but it is not the basis of the sprout when it is destroyed.

original: de lta bas na skad cig re re la sems kyi gnas su gyur pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na skad cig re re la sems kyi gnas su gyur pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is the basis of mind in each moment,

original: skad cig re re kho na la rnam par 'jig par grub bo //
analyzed: skad cig re re kho na la rnam par 'jig par grub bo //
translated: it is established that it is destroyed in each moment.

original: sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œ Arising through the power of mindâ€ means

original: nang dang phyi'i gzugs can thams cad ni sems kyi dbang gis byung ste /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i gzugs can thams cad ni sems kyi dbang gis byung ste /
translated: all internal and external physical things arise through the power of mind.

original: de bas na rgyu skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the cause is momentary,

original: 'bras bu yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the effect should be understood as momentary.

original: gzugs 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin na rgyu rkyen mi rtag pa la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs rtag par ga la 'gyur zhes mdo las byung ba'i tshig gi tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin na rgyu rkyen mi rtag pa la brten nas byung ba'i gzugs rtag par ga la 'gyur zhes mdo las byung ba'i tshig gi tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause and conditions of the arising of form are impermanent. How could form arise from impermanent causes and conditions and be permanent? This should be understood according to the words of a sÅ«tra.

original: sems kyis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ Because it is controlled by mindâ€ means

original: mthu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: mthu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
translated: the mind that is superior in power controls form.

original: des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is transformed in accordance with his wishes.

original: de'i phyir skad cig re la rnam pa gzhan du mos pa @184b gzhan 'byung ba'i skad cig pa nyid du grub bo /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig re la rnam pa gzhan du mos pa @184b gzhan 'byung ba'i skad cig pa nyid du grub bo /
translated: Therefore, it is established that momentariness is the arising of a different aspect in each moment.

original: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is observed that there is a final transformation.

original: skad cig re re la yang rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med par glo bur du gzugs kyi tha mar 'gyur ba mi rigs na //
analyzed: skad cig re re la yang rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med par glo bur du gzugs kyi tha mar 'gyur ba mi rigs na //
translated: It is not reasonable that a form would be transformed at the end without a transformation in its intrinsic nature in each moment.

original: de yang dmigs pas de bas na tha ma'i gzugs kyi 'gyur ba rang gi rkyen gyis skad cig re re las 'gyur pa 'phel ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gzugs skad cig par grub po //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pas de bas na tha ma'i gzugs kyi 'gyur ba rang gi rkyen gyis skad cig re re las 'gyur pa 'phel ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gzugs skad cig par grub po //
translated: Since that is observed, the transformation of the final form arises from a cause that increases the transformation in each moment through its own conditions. Therefore, form is established as momentary.

original: skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is destroyed by its own intrinsic nature without depending on conditions after it has arisen.

original: skyes pa thams cad ni rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa thams cad ni rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Everything that has arisen is destroyed by its own intrinsic nature without depending on conditions.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par gdon mi za bar 'jig ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par gdon mi za bar 'jig ste /
translated: Therefore, without doubt, it perishes without relying on another condition.

original: dngos po skyes pa tsam nyid kyis 'jig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po skyes pa tsam nyid kyis 'jig pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that a thing perishes merely by arising.

original: phyis 'jig go zhes bya ba ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: phyis 'jig go zhes bya ba ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference between saying that it perishes later.

original: de lta bas na rnam par 'jig pa'i tshul can thams cad ni skyes pa can gyis 'jig par 'gyur bas skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par 'jig pa'i tshul can thams cad ni skyes pa can gyis 'jig par 'gyur bas skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Thus, since all that is subject to destruction perishes by the mere fact of arising, it is established that it is momentary.

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever form there is,ğŸ”½all of it is the four great elements and form derived from the four great elements.

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa de dag ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa de dag ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
translated: With what intention was that said?

original: srid pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: It was said with existence in mind.

original: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of a thing that is based on one part is the meaning of derived.

original: 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig la mi ltos par 'byung ba las gyur ba logs chig na rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyogs gcig la mi ltos par 'byung ba las gyur ba logs chig na rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the derived matter does not have the power to arise independently, without relying on one of the primary elements.

original: 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba gang dmigs ba de ni de na yod do zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba gang dmigs ba de ni de na yod do zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: The primary element in which the derived matter is observed is the one that exists there.

original: 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa'i 'dus pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa'i 'dus pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination in which there is only one primary element.

original: 'di lta te /
analyzed: 'di lta te /
translated: For example,

original: sa rdog skam po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa rdog skam po lta bu'o //
translated: a dry lump of clay.

original: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination in which there are two primary elements.

original: de nyid gsher ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsher ba'o //
translated: That same lump of clay when it is moist.

original: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination in which there are three primary elements.

original: de nying dro ba'o //
analyzed: de nying dro ba'o //
translated: That same lump of clay when it is warm.

original: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a combination in which there are all four primary elements.

original: sa rdog de nyid gsher ba dang dro ba dang 'dril zhing 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o //ğŸ”½rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang /
analyzed: sa rdog de nyid gsher ba dang dro ba dang 'dril zhing 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o // rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang /
translated: That same lump of clay when it is moist, warm, and pliable.

original: 'dus pa gang gang la dmigs pa de ni de na yod pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa gang gang la dmigs pa de ni de na yod pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: As for derived matter, the derived matter that is observed in a certain combination is the one that exists there.

original: 'dus pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig pa'ang yod do //
translated: There is one type of derivative form that is a cause of aggregation.

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½'ong lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'ong lta bu'o //
translated: For example,ğŸ”½a lump of iron.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is derivative form that is a cause of aggregation and also has two types of derivative form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: sgra dang dri dad bcas pa'i rlung lta bu'o //ğŸ”½rgyur byas pa'i @185a * //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dad bcas pa'i rlung lta bu'o // rgyur byas pa'i @185a * //
translated: a lump of iron that has sound and smell.

original: gzugs gsum dang ldan pa la yod do //
analyzed: gzugs gsum dang ldan pa la yod do //
translated: There is derivative form that is a cause of aggregation and also has three types of derivative form.ğŸ”½For example,

original: 'di lta ste du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste du ba lta bu'o //
translated: smoke.ğŸ”½It has form, smell, and tactility.

original: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'o khyad par gyis rab tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'o khyad par gyis rab tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is distinguished by its particularities.

original: reg bya'i bye brag ni 'dir yang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i bye brag ni 'dir yang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The particularity of tactility is to be known as lightness.

original: yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: There is derivative form that is a cause of aggregation and also has three types of derivative form.

original: dri rnam pa med pa'i nor bu'i snod kyi nang na yod pa'i tshul gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya yod pa'o //
analyzed: dri rnam pa med pa'i nor bu'i snod kyi nang na yod pa'i tshul gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya yod pa'o //
translated: It is the form that exists in a jeweled vessel that has no smell, and it has taste and tactility.

original: rgyur byas ba'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas ba'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is derivative form that is a cause of aggregation and also has four types of derivative form.ğŸ”½For example,

original: 'di lta ste bu ram gyi rngog ma lta bu'i //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bu ram gyi rngog ma lta bu'i //
translated: molasses candy.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa'ang yod de /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa'ang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also those that possess five types of derivative form.

original: de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'o //ğŸ”½de ltar gzhan la'ang 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'o // de ltar gzhan la'ang 'byung ba'am /
translated: They are the same as the previous, but with sound.

original: 'byung ba las gyur ba gang na gang yod pa de na de yod par rig par ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur ba gang na gang yod pa de na de yod par rig par ba ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that wherever there is an element or a derivative of an element, there is also the other.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: But not elsewhere.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni gzugs 'dus pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de la rdul phra rab lus med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni gzugs 'dus pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de la rdul phra rab lus med par rig par bya'o //
translated: As for the statement that form is the aggregation of atoms, an atom should be understood to be partless.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: It is not a real entity,

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but is merely a conceptual designation.

original: bshig na mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshig na mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it were destroyed, there would be no end to it.

original: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The atom is posited as the limit of a part when it is divided by the mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: blos ci tsam du cha shas kyis bshig pa'i mthar rab tu dbye bar nus pa de rtsam rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: blos ci tsam du cha shas kyis bshig pa'i mthar rab tu dbye bar nus pa de rtsam rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: the atom is posited as the limit of a part when it is divided by the mind to the point where it can no longer be divided.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar lus med kyang rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar lus med kyang rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog ce na /
translated: Why is it that, although it does not exist, the atom is posited?

original: ril po'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig pa dang / gzugs la blos cha shas kyis bshig na 'di thams cad ni gzugs gcig go zhes ril por 'du shes pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ril po'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig pa dang / gzugs la blos cha shas kyis bshig na 'di thams cad ni gzugs gcig go zhes ril por 'du shes pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: In order to destroy the notion of a whole and in order to destroy the notion of a whole, the mind breaks down form into parts. Then, when one is free from the notion of a whole, thinking, â€œAll this is one form,â€

original: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med bar 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med bar 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: one enters into the selflessness of the person in a manner that is in conformity with that.

original: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to enter into the non-substantial establishment of form.

original: de ltar blos rab tu phye nas gzugs ci yang med par rtogs nas /
analyzed: de ltar blos rab tu phye nas gzugs ci yang med par rtogs nas /
translated: Thus, having broken down form with the mind, one realizes that there is no form at all.

original: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: Then, one enters into the non-substantial establishment of form.

original: 'di ltar rnam bar rig pa tsam du 'jug bas chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam bar rig pa tsam du 'jug bas chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one enters into mere representation, and in a manner that is in conformity with the selflessness of dharmas.

original: blo'i dbye ba dang rdzas kyi rab tu dbye bas rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: blo'i dbye ba dang rdzas kyi rab tu dbye bas rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the atom is posited by the division of the mind and by the division of substance.

original: tshig gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: according to the order of the words.

original: yang sdug bsngal 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa'ang yin lam bsrabs pa'ang yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa'ang yin lam bsrabs pa'ang yin pa'ang yod /
translated: Moreover, this unsatisfactoriness is very extensive and not reduced, or it is reduced and not very extensive,

original: bar ma ma bsrabs pa'ang yod /ğŸ”½rjes @185b su ba spabs la ma bsrabs pa'ang yod /
analyzed: bar ma ma bsrabs pa'ang yod / rjes @185b su ba spabs la ma bsrabs pa'ang yod /
translated: or it is middling and not reduced,ğŸ”½or it is reduced and not middling,

original: ches bsrabs la /ğŸ”½bsrabs pa'ang yod /
analyzed: ches bsrabs la / bsrabs pa'ang yod /
translated: or it is very reduced and not middling,ğŸ”½or it is reduced and very reduced,

original: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa'ang yod /
analyzed: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa'ang yod /
translated: or it is very reduced and reduced.

original: sdug bsngal ma yin pa sdug bsngal du snad zhing bsrabs pa chen po nye bar gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin pa sdug bsngal du snad zhing bsrabs pa chen po nye bar gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a great reduction of what is not unsatisfactoriness, but which appears as unsatisfactoriness.

original: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pha ma bsrabs pa gang /ğŸ”½gang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pha ma bsrabs pa gang / gang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: What is the unsatisfactoriness which is very extensive and not reduced?ğŸ”½It is that of those who have not accumulated the roots of good in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod ba'i khams na spyod ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'dod ba'i khams na spyod ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is that of those who have not accumulated the roots of good in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal nyid thams cad dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas na thogs pa med par 'gro ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal nyid thams cad dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas na thogs pa med par 'gro ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: In the desire realm, it is the most extensive and not reduced, since it is the basis of all suffering, it is the basis of the classification of reincarnating beings and birth processes, and it is the basis of the non-accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: go rims bzhin du 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is the most extensive and not reduced in that order.

original: bsrabs pa gang /ğŸ”½de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun ba skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa gang / de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun ba skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: What is reduced?ğŸ”½It is that of those who have generated the factors conducive to liberation.

original: de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa ste /
translated: It is that of those who have generated the factors conducive to liberation.

original: gdon mi za bar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par des par byas pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½bsrabs pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par des par byas pa'i phyir ro // bsrabs pa'ang yin la /
translated: It is reduced because they are certain to attain nirvana.

original: ma bsrabs pa'ang yin pa /ğŸ”½de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bsrabs pa'ang yin pa / de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is both reduced and not reduced.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who have accumulated roots of virtue, since they have attained freedom from attachment to the desire realm through mundane paths.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa rnams kyi ste ;
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa rnams kyi ste ;
translated: The suffering of the realm of desire is that of those who have generated the roots of virtue by being free from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa las yang dag par 'da' bar shin tu nges par byas pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa las yang dag par 'da' bar shin tu nges par byas pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are completely certain to transcend the suffering of suffering, etc., but not permanently.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is the order.

original: bar ma bsrabs pa la sogs ba yang de bzhin du ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma bsrabs pa la sogs ba yang de bzhin du ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The intermediate, the non-thinned, etc., should be applied in the same way, as appropriate.

original: bar ma ma bsrabs pa gang /
analyzed: bar ma ma bsrabs pa gang /
translated: What is the intermediate, the non-thinned?

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those born in the realm of form who have abandoned the factors conducive to liberation.

original: bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa gang /
analyzed: bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa gang /
translated: What is the thinned, the non-thinned?

original: gzugs med par skyes par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those born in the formless realm who have abandoned the factors conducive to liberation.

original: ches bsrabs pa la bsrabs pa gang /
analyzed: ches bsrabs pa la bsrabs pa gang /
translated: What is the thinned, the thinned?

original: gang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those in training.

original: shin tu ches bsrabs pa la bsrabs pa gang /
analyzed: shin tu ches bsrabs pa la bsrabs pa gang /
translated: What is the very much thinned, the thinned?

original: gang mi slob pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: gang mi slob pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The name-and-form of those who are not in training is conditioned by the faculty of life force.

original: sdug bsngal ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin la /
translated: It is not suffering,

original: sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen po nye bar gnas pa gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen po nye bar gnas pa gang /
translated: but it is the appearance of suffering, and it is the great reduction.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyi ste /ğŸ”½bsams bzhin du srid par @186a * //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyi ste / bsams bzhin du srid par @186a * //
translated: It is that of the bodhisattvas who have attained the perfections,

original: skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are reborn in existence through their own power.ğŸ”½It is that of the bodhisattvas who have not attained the perfections,

original: sems can du ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsal bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gsal bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the suffering of many beings is clearly present in their mental continuum.

original: nga chi ba sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: nga chi ba sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: It is said that birth is suffering.

original: 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of birth:

original: dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / lung dum bstan pa'i sems yod pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / lung dum bstan pa'i sems yod pa ste /
translated: with a virtuous mind, with a nonvirtuous mind, and with an indeterminate mind.ğŸ”½When the mind is clear, it should be understood that one dies with a virtuous mind,

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas sam /
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas sam /
translated: either through the power of oneâ€™s own roots of virtue,

original: gzhan gyis bsgrubs bas kyang rung ste /ğŸ”½sems gsal ba ni dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgrubs bas kyang rung ste /ğŸ”½sems gsal ba ni dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: or through the power of another.

original: rang gi mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pas sam /
analyzed: rang gi mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pas sam /
translated: or by the generation of a nonvirtuous thought in oneself,

original: gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
translated: or by the activity of another,

original: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal ba ni mi dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½sems kyi rgyu ba gsal yang rung /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal ba ni mi dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o // sems kyi rgyu ba gsal yang rung /
translated: one should understand that death occurs with a nonvirtuous thought, if the movement of thought is clear.ğŸ”½Even if the movement of thought is not clear,

original: mi gsal yang rung /
analyzed: mi gsal yang rung /
translated: or if the movement of thought is clear,

original: rkyen de gnyis ka ma tshang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen de gnyis ka ma tshang ba'i phyir /
translated: death occurs with a neutral thought, if the two conditions are not complete,

original: mngon par 'du byed mi nus pa'ang rung ste /ğŸ”½lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed mi nus pa'ang rung ste / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and one is not able to form a thought.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Death with a virtuous thought, etc.

original: bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas par rig bar bya'o //ğŸ”½dge ba byed pa'i lus ni thog ma nyid du smad grang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas par rig bar bya'o // dge ba byed pa'i lus ni thog ma nyid du smad grang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: should be understood as referring to the period prior to the thought of death and transmigration that is associated with attachment to self.ğŸ”½The body of one who has practiced virtue first becomes cold at the lower part.

original: mi dge ba byed ba'i lus ni stod grang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba byed ba'i lus ni stod grang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of one who has practiced nonvirtue first becomes cold at the upper part.

original: de la mi dge ba byed ba'i bar ma do'i srid par mngon par 'jug pa ni /ğŸ”½dper na gos nag po'am /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba byed ba'i bar ma do'i srid par mngon par 'jug pa ni / dper na gos nag po'am /
translated: The intermediate existence of those who will commit evil deeds manifests like a black garment

original: mtshan mo mun nag na snang ba lta bu'o //ğŸ”½dge ba byed pa ni dper na gos dkar po'am /
analyzed: mtshan mo mun nag na snang ba lta bu'o // dge ba byed pa ni dper na gos dkar po'am /
translated: or like a night in the dark fortnight.ğŸ”½The intermediate existence of those who will do good deeds manifests like a white garment

original: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: or like a night in the bright fortnight.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
translated: The intermediate existence is in the realm of desire and the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa nas ni 'chi 'pho ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas ni 'chi 'pho ba na'o //
translated: It is in the formless realm when one is dying.

original: de ni yid las byung ba dang / dri za zhes kyang ngo /
analyzed: de ni yid las byung ba dang / dri za zhes kyang ngo /
translated: It is called mental because it is born from the mind, and gandharva because it moves by smell.

original: rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
translated: It is born spontaneously.

original: sems tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½dri za ni dris 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro // dri za ni dris 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is born from the mind alone.ğŸ”½It is called gandharva because it moves by smell.

original: dri dad mthun par skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dri dad mthun par skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It goes to the place of its birth by the smell of the sexual act of its parents.

original: mchog tu thogs na zhag bdun du gnas te /
analyzed: mchog tu thogs na zhag bdun du gnas te /
translated: It lasts at the most seven days.

original: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o //
analyzed: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o //
translated: It dies if it does not find the place of its birth within that time.

original: skye ba'i rkyen rnyed na'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen rnyed na'o //
translated: It is born when it finds the conditions of birth.

original: ci ste / ma rnyed na zhag bdun pa'i 'og tu shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: ci ste / ma rnyed na zhag bdun pa'i 'og tu shi 'phos nas /
translated: If not, then after seven days, it dies and transmigrates.

original: yang bar do'i srid pa nyid du grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang bar do'i srid pa nyid du grub pa'o //
translated: Again, it is established in the intermediate existence.

original: de ltar lan bdun gyi bar du byas nas so //
analyzed: de ltar lan bdun gyi bar du byas nas so //
translated: In this way, it does this up to seven times.

original: ji sten ldog go //
analyzed: ji sten ldog go //
translated: But if it does not, then it turns back.

original: gal te gnas skabs de na gzhan du skye ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan zhing mngon du gyur nas @186b te /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs de na gzhan du skye ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan zhing mngon du gyur nas @186b te /
translated: If at that time, the condition for birth in another place is powerful and present,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: like the arhat bhiká¹£u who has attained the fourth meditation.

original: mnyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
translated: He has the pride of equality.

original: sa de pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na /
analyzed: sa de pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na /
translated: When the intermediate existence of that level is established,

original: thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba rnyed nas /
analyzed: thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba rnyed nas /
translated: he finds the wrong view that denies liberation.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par grub pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the establishment of the intermediate existence of a hell being.

original: de na gnas pa yang la sogs so //
analyzed: de na gnas pa yang la sogs so //
translated: Also, while abiding there, etc.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis dge ba'i las la sogs pa'i sems pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis dge ba'i las la sogs pa'i sems pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because intention regarding virtuous karma, etc. arises through the power of the prior impetus.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong ngo //ğŸ”½gang dag dang lhan cig sngon dge ba'am /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong ngo // gang dag dang lhan cig sngon dge ba'am /
translated: He also sees the sentient beings who are his equals.ğŸ”½He sees those with whom he has previously associated, whether in wholesome or unwholesome actions.

original: mi dge ba kun du spyod par gyur pa de dag dang bdag nyid ltan cig tu 'dug par rmi lam tsam gyi tshod du shes so //
analyzed: mi dge ba kun du spyod par gyur pa de dag dang bdag nyid ltan cig tu 'dug par rmi lam tsam gyi tshod du shes so //
translated: He thinks that he is sitting with them, as if in a dream.

original: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i byad gzugs so //
analyzed: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i byad gzugs so //
translated: He sees the form of the place where he will be reborn.

original: de la sngon logs kyi srid pa'i byad gzugs 'grub po //
analyzed: de la sngon logs kyi srid pa'i byad gzugs 'grub po //
translated: The form of the prior existence is established there.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: After that, the faculties are established.

original: 'gro ba la thags thogs med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba la thags thogs med do //
translated: He is not obstructed in his movement.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing skye ba'i gnas su thogs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing skye ba'i gnas su thogs so //
translated: He moves quickly, as if possessing supernormal power, and is obstructed by the place of rebirth.

original: srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul du 'chi 'pho zhing nying mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul du 'chi 'pho zhing nying mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: He passes away and is reborn like the swing of a scale, rising and falling.

original: bar do'i srid pa na gnas pa ni skye ba'i gnas la 'dod chags bskyed de /
analyzed: bar do'i srid pa na gnas pa ni skye ba'i gnas la 'dod chags bskyed de /
translated: While in the intermediate existence, he generates attachment to the place of rebirth.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa de rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa de rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The other defilements become the conditions for that.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bar do'i srid pa 'gag cing nur nur por rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bar do'i srid pa 'gag cing nur nur por rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa byung ste /
translated: The intermediate existence of one who possesses attachment ceases and the kalala, which possesses consciousness, arises.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the karmic maturation.

original: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du skye gnas bzhi po sgo da las skye ba dang mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba'i dbang po mngon bar 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du skye gnas bzhi po sgo da las skye ba dang mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba'i dbang po mngon bar 'grub po //
translated: Subsequently, the faculties of the four modes of birth, as they occur in dependent origination, are formed: birth from an egg, birth from the womb, birth from heat and moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As they occur in dependent origination means

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs par rim gyis so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs par rim gyis so //
translated: as they occur in the order of name and form and so on.

original: ji skad du /ğŸ”½thog ma nyid du nur nur 'gyur //
analyzed: ji skad du / thog ma nyid du nur nur 'gyur //
translated: As it is said:ğŸ”½First, there is the kalala.

original: nur nur po las mer mer 'gyur //ğŸ”½mer mer po las nar nar 'gyur //
analyzed: nur nur po las mer mer 'gyur // mer mer po las nar nar 'gyur //
translated: From the kalala, the arbuda arises.ğŸ”½From the arbuda, the peÅ›in arises.

original: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur //ğŸ”½gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyus //
analyzed: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur // gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyus //
translated: From the peÅ›in, the ghana arises.ğŸ”½From the ghana, the praÅ›ÄkhÄ arises.

original: skra sbu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
analyzed: skra sbu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
translated: Hair, body hair, nails and so on arise.

original: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni /
translated: and the material faculties

original: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the marks arise in sequence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The Determination of the Truth of Suffering is completed.

original: // / kun 'byung gi bden pa gang /ğŸ”½nyon mongs @187a * //
analyzed: // / kun 'byung gi bden pa gang / nyon mongs @187a * //
translated: What is the truth of origination?

original: pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i las so //ğŸ”½kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni /
analyzed: pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i las so // kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni /
translated: It is the afflictions and the karma that arises under the power of the afflictions.

original: gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
translated: The truth of origination is that from which suffering originates.

original: de yang gang zhen /
analyzed: de yang gang zhen /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i las te /
translated: It is the afflictions and the karma that arises under the power of the afflictions.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term â€œimpure.â€

original: gal te de ltar yin na kun 'byung ba bsten pa la ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa nyid bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na kun 'byung ba bsten pa la ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa nyid bstan zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why did the BhagavÃ¥n teach the truth of origination as existence?

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because existence is the principal cause of all.

original: gtso bor bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang 'byung ba can /
analyzed: gtso bor bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang 'byung ba can /

analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba la / kun 'byung ba'i bden bar bstan pas bstan to //

analyzed: gtso bo'i don gang / gang thams cad du 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of preeminent?ğŸ”½It is the meaning of universal.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gang 'di ltar srid pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba gang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gang 'di ltar srid pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba gang /

original: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba ni /
translated: Craving goes everywhere in all things,

analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa'i lus dang yul gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de lus thob pa la ni sred pa'o //

original: ma thob pa la ni yang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa la ni yang 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: thob pa'i yul rnams ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //

original: ma thob pa'i yul rnams la ni de dang de dag la mngon par dga' bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i yul rnams la ni de dang de dag la mngon par dga' bar rig par bya'o //

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba dang / gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa gnas skabs gsum po dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs thob pa la ni 'bral bar sred do //

analyzed: ma thob pa la ni ma phrad pas sred do //

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni /ğŸ”½thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag gis ni 'brel ba'i sred pa dang / phrad pa'i sred pa'o //

translated: In the circumstance of the suffering of change,ğŸ”½one craves contact with it.ğŸ”½In the circumstance of the suffering of suffering, one craves separation from it.ğŸ”½In the circumstance of the suffering of suffering, one craves separation from it.

analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni gti mug gi sred pa ste /
